story:
Since 2008, Gura Gear has designed and built the most functional and durable camera backpacks and everyday carry bags available.  After years of development, incorporating feedback from our most devoted users, we are proud to launch our updated everyday carry, Chobe 2.0.

 

 

Made for photographers, by photographers, Chobe 2.0 is fully updated to respond to the size and form factor of today’s laptop, tablets, and ever-expanding array of cables, batteries, and chargers that go in your office, travel bag.

 

 

The 13" Chobe is designed for paper-free workflows and mirrorless camera kits

The 16" Chobe is designed for larger format equipment and more carrying capacity

 

 

Each of the over twenty compartments is designed to protect and organize your gear  and provide easy access when you need it.

 

 

Et Cetera, our collection of accessory pouches and cases is specifically designed to fit modularly into Chobe 2.0, making the most efficient use of space.  Additionally, Et Cetera features wide, clear windows so you can see what's in each pouch.

 

 

Digital creatives can carry a full range of camera gear with our customizable inserts, which come in Narrow and Wide sizes for mirrorless and DSLR camera kits.

 

 

No expense is spared in the design and construction of Gear Gear products. For Chobe 2.0, we upgraded the handles to premium leather.  We also added a custom-fitted rain cover with precision-cut openings for the shoulder straps.

 

 

Since the beginning, Gura Gear products have been made with VX-21, a high-tech sailcloth used on racing yachts. Made in the USA by Dimension Polyant, this material is ultra-lightweight, weatherproof, and exceptionally durable. The fabric comes at a cost premium, but we only use the best materials in our products.

In fact, Gura Gear was the first to use Dimension-Polyants's VX-21 in wide production for bags and backpacks.

 

 

 

Commit early and reap the rewards. We are offering special discounts to our pre-launch backers. Select the package that best suits your needs.

 

Gura Gear was started by photographers for photographers. Twelve years ago, Andy Biggs and Trevor Peterson met while photographing on safari in East Africa. One night, over the campfire, they shared their frustrations with all of the camera bags currently on the market, chief among them their weight, functionality and durability.

After discussing everything they wanted in the perfect camera bag, they thought “why not just make it ourselves?” With a sketch on the back of a napkin, countless prototypes, and a patent filing, Gura Gear was born.

story:
Me...

My name is Hallie. I'm 26 and I recently had the beautiful baby you see above. That is the last high quality image I was able to take of my daughter before my camera met it's ultimate demise. In addition to missing hundreds of shots of her every day - I was asked to participate in an exhibit to support CityArts!, an after school arts program designed for kids who don't have access to art classes.

The project I was planning for the CityArts! exhibit was a story telling theme based on the tattoos people have and the stories they tell about the people who have them. That is - until I no longer had a camera.

Being a photographer without a camera is like losing an arm.

The Jist...

I need a new camera. Simple as that. I want to capture images of my daughter. I want to complete my project and help support a wonderful cause. I want to continue booking clients and living my passion.

In exchange for my beloved (needed) camera - I will give out prints,wall art, and photo books.

In addition...

Besides reconnecting me with my real passion in life... I truly want to support the CityArts! organization. I plan on using the a portion of sales from my storytelling project to purchase art supplies for the many art classes CityArts! entails.

If money's tight...

I understand being short on cash (I wouldn't be here if I wasn't). So if you can't contribute - don't sweat it! But please spread the word... facebook, twitter, whatever! Every little bit counts!

story:
SHORT Summary

BASICALLY, as long as the funding goal of $2500 is met, anyone who donates any amount to this fundraiser will receive the wedding CD and DVD. You do have to donate at least $250 to also receive the photo album (that's because it costs us money to make and order those albums from a third party). Read below to find out more about why the $2500 is needed. 


EXTENDED Explanation

Hi! Rosalind & Adam's official wedding photos are almost completely edited and ready to be sent out on CDs (which will be able to be printed at your convenience). As long as people are interested, we are still planning on making, ordering & delivering printed photo albums with all the photos and excerpts from the wedding script&family readings, though these albums obviously have an extra cost associated with their production. 


We also need to finish the wedding video, which will be a fantastic ode to the wedding, complete with a DVD menu that includes a 10-15 minute highlight video of the wedding ceremony & associated events, the Best Man speeches, and the wedding photo slideshow. 


UNFORTUNTATELY Simone's five year old laptop broke down and is not up to the task of editing video. So this fundraiser is to help her buy the necessary equipment and software to complete the editing of all these projects. 

BASICALLY, as long as the funding goal is met, anyone who donates any amount to this fundraiser will receive the wedding CD and DVD. You do have to donate at least $250 to also receive the photo album, and that's because it costs us money to make and order those albums from a third party.

story:
Short Summary

It is a delicate piece that beautifully explores the transition of letting something go, the something you have held onto, to stay numb instead of confronting the initial cause of pain and living again.

The idea and inspiration for the short came from our director's close friend Pol Guasch and his Award Winning story Més o Menys which won the award Joves.Lit 2015 by APELLC. Rubén, our Director, has worked closely with Pol adapting the work into a nostalgic screenplay. 

 

Budget & Breakdown

The budget will be going towards all general costs of production and expenses such as travel, food, cast, etc. 

We already have an amazing script and an eager team, for now a lot of our attention is on the Production Design, Art Department and securing the 2 remaining locations.

Production Design is one of the most important factors that is overlooked in student films and it is massively crucial to ours. We aspire to create a very stylised interior and detail is key. 

** We need your help to make it happen! We hope you like the perks! **

Take a chance to WIN a ticket and join us in London at the BFI (British Film Institute) NFT screening of our films in June by contributing with £35!! The NFT (National Film Theatre) is the BFI’s biggest auditorium!! It is a chance to meet professionals in the industry and you will get to see the first screening of Olivia with us!!

 

Our Team

Director - Rubén González

I have a deep connection with this project, with Olivia I feel very personally attached. Developing this project has reminded me of my own experiences and for that reason I am putting every single part of myself into it to create something as sweet and beautiful as possible.

My passion is photography and art, I have directed some films before as well as doing cinematography and Olivia is something I have been determined to make into a film for a while so I am very excited to finally bringing it to life. Thank you so much for helping us to make Olivia possible, your contributions mean a lot to us, we’ll be always grateful.

 

Producer - Yasmin Seddon

I've been really excited by the opportunity for design with this project and the attention to detail within the screenplay. It's going to be a lot of fun and hard work putting it together. 

Previously I have produced installations and co-produced about me/ corporate videos for companies including Fremantle Media and Salt Tv. Last year I was running and camera assisting on big commercials and live broadcast events. I will be bringing all these skills and experience on set with me.  

We already have great locations and if we do it right, with your help, the film will be just as intricate. Thanks for your help!

 

Cinematographer - Dan Read 

I'm a young aspiring cinematographer who has worked as a DoP on several short films and have also co-directed and edited. I'm currently in my final year at university and I wish to continue my education in cinematography whilst working as a cinematographer in the industry I love. 

 

Sound Recorder - Gersiley de Sousa

Portuguese raised and British improved, I am a citizen who has cultivated comprehensive experience in the decade spent as a filmmaker, photographer and sound operator. In 2010 I completed a Video Post-Production Course. I spent one year working for the Portuguese’s TV Channel TVI. Now I am studying Film and Broadcast Production in London and I hope to develop and produce content which fosters the undifferentiated human spirit across cultural barriers. 

 

Sharing is Caring

If you are not in any position to contribute with money, it’s all good. We just ask if you like the idea that you please share the link, you really help us by doing that as well!

We also have a live mood board on Instagram if you would like to follow: @oliviathefilm

story:
My name is Harry Aaron, and I'm a photographer. For the last four years of my life, I've dedicated my career and education to bettering my work and becoming a professional. In the time since then, I've had the opportunity to shoot for WWE, New York Daily News, Suicide Girls, and more. Constantly staying busy and setting new goals to improve upon.

On November 4th at about 11:45PM, my car was broken into and several pieces of photography and video equipment, as well as irreplaceable hard drives, were stolen. 

My personal Canon EOS 6D DSLR, Canon 50MM, Rode VideoPro Mic and Seagate hard drives were all packed in my black and green Lowepro bag in my backseat, along with my rented equipment for my current job: a Fujifilm X-T1 Mirrorless camera, XF 90 lens, XF 10-24 lens, and spare battery and charger.

Because no noticeable signs of forced entry were reported by the police, the likelihood that my insurer will provide any assistance has proven to be slim to none. In all, to replace my personal equipment and the rented kit I am facing over $5400 in costs.

Since graduating from college this past May, I've made the decision to build my freelance work as my key source of income, finding growth in a new market in this new chapter of my life. I lost not only the equipment, but also nearly all of my videos and photos dating back to 2013, as well as my tools to keep my head above water financially.

Crowdfunding is not how I hoped to resolve this, but in my current position I find it may be my only way to get back on my feet in a timely manner.

Each and every person who contributes will receive something for their help, and should know that I'll be endlessly grateful for the assistance.

All the best,

Harry

story:
Introducing the DUO Daypack...

With your help, we were through crowdfunding almost 4 years ago. After 5 kick-ass campaigns, nearly $2 Million in funding, and successfully moving out of dad's basement (literally), we’re stoked to be back with our latest solution for commuters, creators, photographers, and travelers who want more out of their gear.  

The DUO Daypack is a dawn-to-dusk, daily carrying beast that was tirelessly designed to go from work to play… to play to work… to work to work… to play to play… or whatever else you call your daily grinds, errands, and passions. 

WANDRD wasn’t born in a boardroom and it isn’t the brainchild of some serial entrepreneurs looking for the next “big thing”. No, WANDRD was born from two brothers who weren’t satisfied with the status quo. And while we've grown into a thriving team of passionate travelers, photographers, and creators (and a couple of smart asses), the same principles that founded our company run strongly through our veins.

Our mission is simple: to inspire people to get out and live passionately; exploring, creating, and living life in the moment. We just happen to do that by creating the world’s best gear.

Is there anything more frustrating than digging through every item you own just to find your headphones at the bottom your bag? Well, yes... actually... there are things that are much more frustrating. Like slow internet or kids sneezing directly into your open eyes. But it still sucks, right?

With our radical, new InfiniteZip™ system, you get the opening of your choice – which means no more digging for what you need, no matter where it’s located. 

Our bags have won awards for their innovative functionality, and the DUO is no exception. We’ve invented a protection system that pops into place when needed, and just as easily pops out of the way when it’s not in use. Pretty neat, eh?

The protective Pop Cube is a multifunctional space for a variety of tech and photography items. We have also included a padded EVA foam divider that can be adjusted to snuggly fit your camera, lenses, drone, shoes, or other gear.

We've also built in dual padded expansion pockets, made out of a dense EVA foam. Perfect for small cameras, hard drives, lenses, and anything else that needs extra protection.  

Don't let the sleek and minimal design of the DUO fool you, the inside is an organizational beast. Most bags turn into what we like to call a black hole, and finding your phone charger is like trying to keep track of a 5-year-old at Disneyland. But no more. With pockets, pouches, and organizers galore, you never have to wonder where your kid, I mean, phone charger is ever again. 

Most people tout quality, but few back it up with a no questions asked lifetime guarantee. And we can afford to do that because everything we do — from the materials we use to the way our bags are built – is the best of the best.  

While we don’t recommend you taking a power washer to your bag, we did it for you in the name of science. And you know what? The DUO came out dry as a whistle. What does that even mean, "dry as a whistle?" Nobody knows, but it's provocative. But seriously, do you know who does know? The DUO does.

Our dual airflow back panel is made of molded EVA foam with built in dual airflow channels for maximum breathability and comfort.

The DUO is built out of a waterproof 840D Jr. Ballistic Nylon with a newly developed 5pm coating and weather resistant YKK zippers. Not only do they withstand the toughest of environments, but they're also damn sexy — kind of like Bear Grylls.

Dual grab handles are made of nylon seatbelt webbing, making them soft to the touch, tough as nails, and comfortable to hold.

story:
FIND DUDR ON www.DUDR.info

ON TECHCRUNCH: TECHCRUNCH/DUDR


HOW DUDR WORKS
YOU AND YOUR FRIENDS NEARBY JUST PRESSES THE DUDR-ICON SIMULTANEOUSLY - THE APP AUTOMATICALLY CREATES ONE PRIVAT PHOTO ALBUM. EVERYONE CAN THEN SHOOT 24 PHOTOS IN 24 HOURS. AFTER 24 HOURS YOU AND YOUR FRIENDS GETS A PUSH MESSAGE AND CAN SEE ALL THE PHOTOS FROM THE LAST 24 HOURS.

                                             


THE STORY BEHIND DUDR

Stefan came back from his vacation - the Fifa World Cup in Brazil. He stayed there with his 3 DUDES in an apartment near Ipanema-Beach. They bought 10 quicksnaps (disposable cameras) - one for every day with 24 shots. After their vacation nobody could remember what actually happened.

A week after, I was invited to their photo-show evening! All the DUDES were so excited, there were pictures... OMG.....!

I saw the potential for an app that provided a way to "time-delay" the viewing of photos from an event or place, and together with my coding team developed the DUDR app - 24 SHOTS in 24 HOURS!


            THE DUDR APP ICON 

                


NEXT STEP

- DUDR Android App release april 2015


We thank you for your help - lets spread the word - ITS DUDR TIME!

Kind regards

Bernd (CEO), Susanne (Design), Raul (App developer)


ABOUT THE FOUNDER

Bernd Schmekel, Founder and CEO of the Arthur-Film GmbH
He worked for more than twelve years for various radio and TV stations, successfully developing new TV formats, and producing, among other works, unique images of the German Navy. He founded Arthur-Film GmbH in 2007 to produce freelance productions and together with his team accompanies people with extraordinary stories. Corporate clients include Campari, Saturn and OMV. He is also Founder and CEO of The World of Pictures Company, the first photo agency for smartphone photos, allowing everyone to earn money with their creativity. His most recent project, founded 2011 together with Susanne Odendahl, is Picjerry, which has emerged as an attractive competitor to getty images and fotolia.

www.picjerry.info

story:
My name is Jessica Van Fleteren and I was recently awarded a National Geographic Young Explorers grant. In April of 2016, I will be traveling to Kenya to partner with Save the Elephants affiliated organization Elephants and Bees. I will be documenting the use of African Bee hives as a mitigation technique in the human-elephant conflict and helping with monitoring their bee hive projects.

 



Placing beehives along wire fences around the circumference of crops helps to create a needed barrier between farmland and hungry elephants.

  • Using Audio playback recordings Dr. Lucy King of Elephants and Bees has found that African Elephants are extremely fearful of Africanized honey bees.

  • Elephants will emit a low rumble when they hear bees buzzing to notify the herd of potential danger.

  • Driving elephants away will protect both farmers and elephants.

As an explorer my main goal is to document this incredible process in order to spread awareness through photography and digital media. In addition to photographing my surroundings during my time in Kenya I will also be learning about camera traps, helping monitor beehives, help extract honey and support conservation education in the local village. After the completion of this project I will be focusing on continual grant support to work with human-wildlife conflicts and working towards conservation education initiatives.

For more information on Elephants and Bees amazing work watch the following video produced by Disney:

 





I have spent the past two years studying and working for funding to photograph elephant conservation efforts in Kenya. I have been a Fulbright finalist twice and thanks to the NGYE grant and your help I will finally be able to make my dreams a reality. I spent last summer learning all that I possibly could about honey bees, being mentored by Chicago beekeepers, and zoologists. In addition I have undergone 6 months of Immunotherapy in order to build up my immunity and fight off my allergy to honey bees. I have spent months studying Swahili through the Swahili Institute of Chicago. My drive and passion for this project might be what some people consider a little crazy. But supporting this cause is worth the time and effort its taken to get here. 


 


While NGYE grant is covering my living costs while in Kenya (housing, meals, some gear needed for exploration, research costs associated with working with Elephants and Bees) I need to raise $7855.00 in additional funding in order to complete this project safely and effectively . If I do not reach my goal I will still keep the amount of funds raised but Indiegogo will take a larger percent from my total fundraised; the percent is less if I reach my goal. This campaign will help me cover the following cost:

Housing - Covered
Food - Covered 
Flight - $1300.00
Camera Gear - $1700.00
Sound Gear - $380.00
Media Management - $1050.00
Heath Insurance - $600.00
Transportation in country - $1200.00
Supplies - $480.00
BeeKeeping Gear  -$345.00  
(Will be donated to the program upon completion)
Visa & Passport - $200.00
Immunization Upkeep - $400.00
Cellphone and Internet - $200.00
Total $7855.00


A lot. From health and beauty products to gourmet chocolate, honey, gifts from Kenya, handmade artist handcrafted products and so much more. Check out the "Gallery" page for more photos !



I realize some people may not be able to help fund JV And The Bees. That doesn't mean you still can't help. It would be just as helpful to share this project with friends or family. You can share this project through Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, emails, phone calls,  smoke signals, snail mail, face to face and of course via text next to your favorite emoji.


Stay Connected !

Join me on my adventure by following my blog and social media channels. In the upcoming weeks as my project is launched there will be a series of artist and sponsor interviews posted on the page and on my blog so you can get to know the amazing and talented people who have been involved in building this campaign.


Social:

http://jessicavanfleteren.com/the-wild-inside

https://www.instagram.com/jvanfleteren/

https://www.facebook.com/JessicaVanFleterenPhotography/

https://twitter.com/photogeographic



This campaign would not be possible if not for the support of the following sponsors and artists.

Artist Johanna Mueller

Jana Kinsman - Bike a Bee

Production Team Lynn Millspaugh and Derek Souders

Photographer Tim Perpich and Stylist Kelly Morrison

Artist Ryan Tavarez

Artist Hayley Hungerford

Artist Andie Mellon

Artist and Jewelry by AmazziRoots

BowTruss Coffee Roasters

Savannah Bee Company

Vosges Chocolate

Bees Knees Food

Artifact Uprising

John Bailey's Bees

Blossoms Barn Soap Company

Lush

Alaffia

story:
UPDATE (2012-09-19):

Finally, the aluminum frames are here! I have started assembly of the Guerricam stabilizers and I will begin shipping them out very soon (by the end of the week). Here are a few pictures of the final production unit before assembly:
 

 

 

 

UPDATE (2012-06-26):

As promised, here are some pics of the final prototype. As you can see, there are many, many improvements over the original prototype:

- overall finish is of much higher quality

- nice rubber hand grip

- longer (more stable) stabilizer arm

- smaller, neater thumb screws

- high quality brass thumb nuts

- much more adjustments to balance a wider range of cameras

- thin anti-slip rubber padding instead of felt padding

- and many more details ...

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

And all the parts required to assemble the stabilizers. All that is missing are the stabilizer arms.

 

 

 

 

 

 

UPDATE (2012-06-21):

Some good news finally! I have finally found a shop that seems to be able to deliver. They have provided me 2 samples, for testing, of the aluminum frame that they produced according to the design I gave them. I have assembled a unit and it seems perfectly good.

I have also received all the other parts necessary to complete assembly of the stabilizers. This is a lot of hardware.

I'll post pictures of it all in the next few days for your viewing pleasure!

If everything goes well, I should be shipping out the stabilizers starting mid-July.

 

UPDATE (2012-05-08):

Ok, this is going to sound ridiculous, but the 2nd machine shop did not complete the work and doesn't even want to send me the unfinished parts so that I can hand them over to another shop to finish.

So, I'm back to square one. This is turning out to be ridiculously complicated for no reason.

I want you guys to know that I'm still not giving up on this. You WILL get your stabilizer. When? I'd love to be able to give an answer to that question, but as you noticed, it is impossible at the moment!

So, again, I apologize for the delay, but rest assured that I will deliver!

 

UPDATE (2012-01-25):

Hello funders!

Here's an update on the status of the project.

After completing the manufacturing of the stabilizer, we noticed a defect. The aluminum frame had cracks at the bends, which could compromise its strength. The cracks were not visible until the frames had been anodized.

I did not want to ship a sub-par products so we are having all the stabilizers re-manufactured from scratch using a different grade of aluminum.

The machine shop I'm working with is kind enough to put a rush on this project. So the waiting shouldn't be as long as for the first try.

I sincerely apologize for the delay. And I hope you can understand that there can be complications and unexpected delays with a start-up company like mine.

Thank you for your understanding.

 

IF YOU MISSED THE CAMPAIGN BUT STILL WANT TO BUY ONE, THE GUERRICAM CAMERA STABILIZER WILL BE FOR SALE SOON. AN ANNOUNCEMENT WILL BE POSTED ABOUT IT.

-------

UPDATE (2011-11-21): The campaign is now over! Thanks everyone for the support! The first batch is currently in production and will be ready in about 2-3 weeks. The first stabilizers will start shipping out a few days later.

-------

UPDATE (2011-11-14): Only 5 days left! The first 25 stabilizers are all spoken for. And there are already 9/35 of the $35 stabilizers gone. Also, a bunch of local filmmakers have arranged to pay me directly. This was enough to convince me to go ahead and order the first batch of 100 stabilizers. THE FIRST BATCH SHOULD BE READY IN ABOUT 3 WEEKS!!!

If you're a member on a forum (filmmaking-related or not), it would be great if you could start a thread about this campaign. If you're on Twitter, please write a quick tweet like: Why DIY when you can buy it so cheap? $35 Camera Stabilizer! http://igg.me/p/45439

To everyone that already paid for a stabilizer, or anyone that helped spread the word in any way: thank you so much for your support guys!

PS: If you forgot to pay for the shipping fees, please do so ASAP! To do this, select the "Other Amount" contribution, enter the appropriate amount ($12 for Canada, $15 for USA, $20 International), and click the "CONTRIBUTE NOW" button.

-------

UPDATE (2011-11-02): Already half-way through the campaign! 18 of the first 25 stabilizers are already spoken for. Also, a bunch of local guys are excited about this and have arranged to pay me directly. So, that leaves a few more spots at the $25 price point.

Also, I have made a short video showcasing the capabilities of the stabilizer. I have made it the main video for this campaign. The old video is still available here: http://vimeo.com/30698113

Next up is a video showing exactly how the stabilizer works with different kind of cameras (DSLR, Point-and-Shoot, etc...). I'll show you how to balance the stabilizer and maybe a few tips on how to use it, but I'm still very new at this, so we'll see!

Finally, we need to make even more noise! If you're a member on a forum (filmmaking-related or not), it would be great if you could start a thread about this campaign. If you're on Twitter, please write a quick tweet like: Why DIY when you can buy it so cheap? $25 Camera Stabilizer! http://igg.me/p/45439

Again, to everyone that already paid for a stabilizer, or anyone that helped spread the word in any way: thank you so much for your support guys! 

-------

UPDATE (2011-10-26): We're already a little more than 1 week into the campaign! 10 of the first 25 stabilizers are already spoken for. That's a great start :D Thank you so much for your support guys! A few blogs are talking about this campaign (NextWaveDV, FishXpressions, and Video For Real Estate). The word is also starting to spread on Twitter and Facebook.

But we need to make even more noise! If you're on Twitter, please write a quick tweet like "Help make it happen for the $25 Camera Stabilizer! http://igg.me/p/45439". If you're a member on a forum (video-related or not), it would be great if you could start a thread about this campaign.

Finally, I'm working on a new video to better showoff the performance of the stabilizer. And also, to show exactly how it works with a DSLR mounted and balanced.

-------

Thanks for checking out my IndieGoGo project! Watch the video, become a backer and spread the word! Message me on Twitter or Facebook if you have any feedback or questions. Thanks!



What is the GUERRICAM Camera Stabilizer?

The GUERRICAM Camera Stabilizer is a device to which you mount a camera that enables fluid handheld shots. Watch the video to see what it is capable off.

The Stabilizer was designed to work with most DSLR cameras and consumer camcorders. It is optimized for DSLRs such as the Canon 5D Mk2, the T2i, the Nikon D3000, or the D7000, and it is also compatible with handheld camcorders. With some creativity you can also mount ultra-lightweight cameras like the GoPro. We're working on an adapter to make this very simple.

How different from the Prototype will the Production Stabilizer be?

The Stabilizer you see in the demo video is the Prototype I built myself with limited tools. The production Stabilizer will be professionally manufactured. You can except a much nicer overall finish and higher quality hardware. Some differences include:

- anodized black aluminum frame (instead of black paint)
- brass thumb nuts (instead of wings nuts for adjustments)
- thinner and denser protective felt (instead of low-density felt)
- rubber grip handle (instead of a piece of wood!)




What's the money for?

Backers for this project will be helping to create the first production run of the GUERRICAM Stabilizer. Your pledges will enable me to move forward with orders for each of the 18 different parts in a Stabilizer and to continue building low-cost gear for filmmakers. Backers pledge to pay for their selected perks only if we meet the funding goal of $3,450. I'm grateful for every $1 pledged!

What perks are available?

You can get any perks listed below by pledging the appropriate amount.

First 25 GUERRICAM Stabilizers : $25 each + shipping
Next 35 GUERRICAM Stabilizers : $35 each + shipping
Next 40 GUERRICAM Stabilizers : $40 each + shipping

After the first 100 Stabilizers are pledged for, you can still get one for the regular price.

GUERRICAM Stabilizer - $50 each + shipping

How much does shipping costs?

Shipping is as follows:

Montreal : FREE pick-up available
Canada: $12 for 1 stabilizer + $5 per additional stabilizer
USA: $15 for 1 stabilizer + $7 per additional stabilizer
International: $20 for 1 stabilizer + $10 per additional stabilizer

When will I receive my GUERRICAM Stabilizer?

We will start the production of the Stabilizers as soon as the campaign is over assuming it is successful. We will start shipping the Stabilizers as early as 3 weeks after the campaign is over.

What makes the GUERRICAM Stabilizer so cool?

With a camera stabilizer you will be able to produce smooth, fluid shots that are impossible to achieve handheld. Some examples of such hard-to-achieve shots include: panning, tracking, in-car (or any other vehicle), following someone, running, etc...

How do I use it?

The Stabilizer is very easy to figure out. Simply attach your camera or camcorder like you would on a tripod. Then balance the stabilizer with the weights included. And that's it, you can start recording right away!

Will there be future GUERRICAM products?

You know it! I had a lot of fun designing the Stabilizer. I'm also very happy I was able to achieve this design with such a low-cost which allows practically anyone to gear up, even on the smallest budgets. I want to continue in this direction and offer a wide range of gear for guerrilla filmmakers who can't afford the more expensive stuff. I have already started developing a low-cost slider and a low-cost rig. Send me a Twitter or Facebook message if you have any suggestions!

What is GUERRICAM?

GUERRICAM is the company I started to sell the Stabilizer. It's just me and some friends that have volunteered tons of time toward the company, but we're hoping IndieGoGo can help us take the company to the next level! GUERRICAM is based in Montreal, Canada.

Can I help you in any other way?

Indeed! There are many other ways you can help. The most important is to spread the word about this campaign. You can do so be sharing the link to this campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, Google+. Talk about it in forums, on YouTube, on Vimeo. Email your friends and family about it. You can also invite your friends to "Like" our Facebook Page, follow us on Twitter. Make some noise! :)

story:
Short Summary

One of the few things I can do to stay active is take photos, As a Parkinson's patient your hobby choices....make that any activity choices....are limited.  I have fallen in love with photos.  I want to take my photography to the next level, but my income is limited.  Simply said your funds will go to my and my families sanity. I am a young, 37 y.o., father and husband.

What We Need & What You Get

Your funds will be going to the purchase of a new Sony A7 camera.  I will be happy to share my photos and a receipt if possible.

The Impact

Listen, I am going to be honest.  This donation I am asking for won't save the world, won't help a community.  It helps me and my sanity.  Your support will help me stay off the couch.  My current camera has met its maker though served me well.

Risks & Challenges

There may be a time when performing photography is even out of my reach.  In which case the camera will be no good to me but I will pass it on.

Other Ways You Can Help

Pass on my story, ask others to contribute

story:
Labphotographer Without Camera

Hi everyone, my name is Kristof Hegedüs and I'm a chemistry student from Hungary, Europe. I started a blog in 2012 March named "Pictures from an organic chemistry laboratory" where I publish a new picture every day from the lab. The pictures are mainly from the reactions, compounds what I have made during my scientific research and I usually add some info from them e.g.: why not to breathe  hydrogen cyanide. So far I have submitted more than a thousand posts with more than 1200 pictures during the years and the blog has got ten thousands of followers for now. 

Why I'm asking for your help?

My current camera (Nikon D5000) is almost dying. I've made 90.000 photographs, and I can't buy new. The shutter in the Nikon D5000 body is rated to 100.000 shots, so my camera and with this, the blog is also near to it's end. 

With your help I would like to buy a new camera body what is also capable for taking high quality videos and helps me to continue photographing chemistry.


How can you help?

1. Share the IndieGoGo page on Facebook & Twitter: http://igg.me/at/labphotographer1 

2. Just visit the blog or share it somewhere: labphoto.tumblr.com

3. Browse the shop at Society6 to get the best pictures from the blog on your wall: http://society6.com/labphoto

4. For donors who would like to help with cryptocurrencies:
 Bitcoin: 1FDFs9Cf59s8qFUdmfWQJ9A99fzUdAqtHP
 DogeCoin: DDAXhWcFLYyiWzy48kRZntSVkrsbbbijDD
-perks are aviable for these donations also, contact me after you made a donation.



Thank you!

labphoto.tumblr.com


A few picture from the blog:

story:
Dear everybody,

My name is Max Gyselinck, I am a Belgian freelance photographer based in Athens, Greece since 2002. My work mainly focuses on social and political issues, from the Greek economic crisis and its consequences to the Mediterranean refugee issue. I’ve been published and collaborating on assignments with numerous international newspapers and magazines such as Le Monde, Le Soir, l'Obs, Land, Le Figaro, Causette, Le Parisien, l'Internazionale, The Guardian among others.

As some of you already know, my beloved camera Canon EOS 5D mk2 got stolen on Friday, 15th of July, in the center of Athens as I was taking pictures of the Athens’s town hall coloured by the French flag in tribute to the recent attack in Nice, Southern France. Attached to the camera was a Canon EF 24-105 f/4L IS USM lens.

This camera followed me everywhere in Greece and abroad, helped me to capture the post-war in Georgia and Lebanon, the Srebrenica’s massacre commemorations till the economic and refugee crisis in Greece and its consequences.

As a freelance photographer, I can’t afford buying new equipment, especially in these difficult economic times in Greece and throughout Europe, photographers’ incomes are getting lower & lower, newspapers and magazines pay for publications with delay, clients ask for competitive and very low rates that make it sometimes difficult to even cover the basic cost of living.

Freelance photographers don’t depend on any organization or agencies susceptible to cover stolen or damaged camera expenses.

Goals

I need to raise 3000 EUR to cover the cost of my stolen equipment, the camera body and the lens that was attached on it.

What you’ll get

Donators will receive a range of visual goodies, depending on their donation,including high quality prints up to 30x40, printed postcards, portrait sessions and photography lessons for those based in Athens.

Other ways to help

Even if you can’t contribute financially, which is completely understandable, you still can support me by sharing the campaign with your friends and relatives which is also a major help! Thank you very much.

Be certain to use the IndieGoGo share tools. It’s the easiest way to pass the word along.

story: Everyone knows I love taking pictures at all the shows I go to. I go to as many shows as I can for the music, but there are also great friends that come along with that music. Have been going to big venues for national acts since I was a sophomore in high school, but after my divorce a few years ago, I got real big into the local music.So many amazing musicians just around the corner and even more wonderful people with them. I started taking the good camera I bought to capture the precious moments of my kids growing up to the shows with me. Turned out to be good at capturing the bands I love and the new friends I make all the time and saving these moments forever. I also share these moments that I captured with everyone so we can all enjoy and remember what a great time that show was. Well...... on Friday the 13, the image sensor went out on the camera and I managed to tear up the lens gears trying to get it to work. Only got 2 pictures that night before the show even started. Went to 5 shows that weekend and everyone was asking where my camera was. I was lost without it and felt like I was not doing my part for the metal community that I am proud to be a part of. I had that one for 8 years, so there is no warranty left and repair costs are close to the cost of a newer model camera. I am going to stick with the same series of camera as it is the best pocket camera I can get into any show with and not need a press pass to use. There were several musicians that mentioned having a benefit show or starting a fundraiser so I can replace my camera and continue to capture amazing images of my friends and the wonderful bands some of them are in, as well as the national acts that come through. Of course I will continue to share all of these with every one of you. I try never to ask for money from people and you all know I would do absolutely anything I can for any of you if I am able. Since the divorce and foreclosures, I just have no extra money at all and I am just barely getting by and proving for my kids. There are 2 different cameras in this series that I am looking at. The 1st will come out in a couple of weeks and has a newer processor that will be better at the low light shots and it has a newer image sensor than my last one, so that problem will not happen again. The 2nd one is last years model, but the image sensor is 3 times the size of the 1st one. The processor in that one is also last years, so it is not as fast as the new one. But with it being 3 times bigger, it has it's own advantages. With that size comes a cost though. The 1st one is about $600 and the 2nd one is about $800. I have set my goal at $900 to cover fees on here and shipping and tax or anything else that comes up.
story_txt: Everyone knows I love taking pictures at all the shows I go to. I go to as many shows as I can for the music, but there are also great friends that come along with that music. Have been going to big venues for national acts since I was a sophomore in high school, but after my divorce a few years ago, I got real big into the local music.So many amazing musicians just around the corner and even more wonderful people with them. I started taking the good camera I bought to capture the precious moments of my kids growing up to the shows with me. Turned out to be good at capturing the bands I love and the new friends I make all the time and saving these moments forever. I also share these moments that I captured with everyone so we can all enjoy and remember what a great time that show was. Well...... on Friday the 13, the image sensor went out on the camera and I managed to tear up the lens gears trying to get it to work. Only got 2 pictures that night before the show even started. Went to 5 shows that weekend and everyone was asking where my camera was. I was lost without it and felt like I was not doing my part for the metal community that I am proud to be a part of. I had that one for 8 years, so there is no warranty left and repair costs are close to the cost of a newer model camera. I am going to stick with the same series of camera as it is the best pocket camera I can get into any show with and not need a press pass to use. Of course I will continue to share all of these with every one of you. I try never to ask for money from people and you all know I would do absolutely anything I can for any of you if I am able. Since the divorce and foreclosures, I just have no extra money at all and I am just barely getting by and proving for my kids. There are 2 different cameras in this series that I am looking at. The 1st will come out in a couple of weeks and has a newer processor that will be better at the low light shots and it has a newer image sensor than my last one, so that problem will not happen again. story: During my visit to NYC my camera (Canon Rebel T3i) and lens (Sigma 10-20mm) was stolen during a training session at one of the local spots. I've filed a report to the local security and police without any luck. While I am not typically one to ask for money from others, I would appreciate any help I can receive from the community as I hope to replace my gear.

I've filed a report to the local security and police without any luck.  While I am not typically one to ask for money from others, I would appreciate any help I can receive from the community as I hope to replace my gear.

story:
Hi

I am Daniel from Hungary. I am a college student and I am studying International Business at a Hungarian college. In my free time I love taking photos of nature and people and this hobby became my passion thus I developed a skill which I want to hit the professional level with. For that purpose I am raising money for a DSLR camera as a Christmas present for myself. This not only would help me to evolve as an artist but it would also let me to exploit my full potential, achieving a higher level of professionalism in photography.

History

It all started in 2006 when I got my my first 2 megapixel camera and its macro mode blew me away. I was photographing all the flowers and plants around and it made me so happy that I could capture all of those beautiful moments, even though those picures were noisy but it turned out people were loving them still. In 2008 I got my 8 megapixel camera from my father, which led me to capture thousands of pictures. I owned that camera for 4 years and only then I could afford to buy myself a 12 megapixel "bridge" camera from my scholarship. It was way more professional than my older cameras were, with manually adjustable shutter speed and aperture values but yet still not enough to let me do what I really want to do due to the lens distortion and point-and-shoot limiations. I feel literally blocked from many of the possibilities caused by my narrow hardware and that also lowers my enthusiasm. People love my work and some of them would like me to make portfolios of them but with my current camera it is just not as good as it gets. That is why I am here to change that and ask for your help, to get me a new camera that gives me wings to fly on photography's sky. 

Plans and Aims

The camera I want is a Nikon D3300 with special lens. That would cost me about $650 in Hungary, all of the raised money goes for this purpose. This is not the only thing I need but with this tool I will have the opportunity to earn money as a photographer and get the real chance to evolve, and later, create my own studio. I do share my photographs here where you can check out my artworks. If you like them, please support it by donating here or sharing my site with others, giving me the ability to do even better.

Thank you in advance!

Daniel

story:
As photography lovers, we are always looking for new techniques to create the most creative and stunning photoshoots. To achieve that, we first needed to take control of the most important asset in photography, the light.


Light Painting is a technique in which exposures are made by moving a hand-held light source while taking a long exposure photograph. You may think that it is easy, but it isn’t, a lot of patience and accessories are needed to master this technique. So we thought, why not make it easier? 

After a lot of thought, we came up with the idea of an all-in-one light painting stick, Magilight. The easiest and most professional tool to improve your light painting photography. Create stunning photographs, print your designs, animations, backgrounds and more at the reach of your hand.

No more light bulbs, flashlights, light cords or any other light source will be needed thanks to the 144 High-resolution RGB LEDs. With Magilight just click and wave, the stick will do the rest.  The effect will totally astonish you.

 
“There are endless options that go well beyond what's possible to achieve with the tubes.”
Beta Review by Eric Paré
 
"It’ll have a permanent spot in my gear bag! Highly Recommended."
Beta Review by Zach Alan

 

No matter what you want to create, Magilight is the perfect tool. With a fully equipped design, it offers you more effects and functionalities than any other light painting accessories, yet is delightfully simple to use. It will totally unleash your creative imagination.

Discover more than 15 million colors in one place, with the 144 LED light bulbs.

Thanks to the screw hole, Magilight is compatible with Drones and diverse accessories

Print your favorite images and unleash your creativity

With the barrel rotator. Create and print easily perfect geometric shapes.

For other designs and pattern, click here:  http://bit.ly/2Dizjm1

Magilight has various modes, which helps you to create easier and more. The animation mode helps you create an animation without choosing the picture one by one when you shoot the images. Put the animations into a folder. Turn this mode on, after finishing one shot, just press “OK”, it will start to display the next image automatically.

 

Using the "Blink" mode allows you to get a special flashing light effect for your photograph. By adjusting the “Blink” value, you can control the frequency of the flicker. You can control the brightness during the flickering by adjusting “BlinkLevel” value.


With the adjustable light function, you can control the brightness, warmth and RGB values. You can also use Magilight as a colorful background light source to create the great effect.

Magilight can also be used as a light source


Settings Demo

 

 

To fit all kind of needs and thanks to the feedback of different light painting artist, we have created the Mini LED Bar accessory. A smaller stick with 43 LED Bulbs, especially to create light trails and paint freely like a Picasso with its brush.

If you want to use the mini LED bar, you need to purchase the Magilight perk. Because it needs to be connected to Magilight's controller so that it can work.

 

 

 

The accessories will be shipped together with the Magilight perk. Please make sure you have ordered the Magilight perk, nor the order of accessories will be refunded.

 

 



As creators, we are photography and light painting photography enthusiasts. We have used many light painting products on the market, but we are not satisfied with the choices. They are either expensive or lack functionality, and in most cases, we can only use them for fun but not for the professional realm. So we fell in love with the idea of producing our own, professional grade, light painting gear. Now, our team has grown from initial 2 to 11 members. We love photography, we love the art of light painting, and we love what we are doing now. It couldn’t be more thrilling to get more and more amazing pixels entered into different fields. We would like to invite you to join this incredible journey with us. Believe us, you will love this magic stick.

Fotorgear is founded by a group of experienced designers, product developers, and photography enthusiasts. After a ton of hard work and improvement, we are able to assess and mitigate all the foreseeable risks and challenges. Before launching our project on Indiegogo, we have already conducted two pilot production, sending our products to friends and professional photographers for testing and reviewing. We have improved the deficiency of the product design based on their feedback and suggestions.

Apart from that, we also built out a specific plan for our manufacturing process. So we have confidence in shipping Magilight on time. If there is any change due to materials, suppliers and unforeseen events, we’ll ensure that we keep each of our supporters fully updated. Now, we had finalized our design and are ready to bring Magilight to life, but we need your support. Your support not only gives us the ability to start mass production and build the best products we can imagine but allows us to continue to work on new ideas.

 

Can I only buy the mini LED bar?

No, your mini LED bar will be shipped with Magilight perk, if you did not buy the Magilight perk, It wouldn’t be shipped out,  and we will refund your order. The mini LED bar, as an accessory, needs to be connected with Magilight’s controller to get it worked.

Is the mini LED bar (or the wireless receiver) will be shipped with my Magilight perk?

Yes, your mini LED bar (or the wireless receiver) will be shipped with your Magilight perk. And there is no extra fee for the shipment.

Does the  Magilight works with other receivers/triggers?

The signal of Magilight is special. Normal receiver can't receive the signal.

When will you ship the item?

Magilight is expected to begin shipping in April 2018.

How will my order be shipped?

Magilight is supposed to be shipped via DHL/UPS. We will provide a shipping notification and the tracking information for each order. Due to the changes in courier regulations on lithium battery products, our shipping methods are subjected to change.

What’s the warranty period for Magilight?

We offer a 1-year manufacturer warranty and will fix any failures or defects that occur through normal use. Our support staff is always available to help as well, so if you're having issues using your product please let us know and we'll take care of it. The batteries are not included in the one year warranty.

Do I have to pay VAT and duty?

For international order, the full value of the package will be declared and is subject to your country’s VAT and customs fees. All international duties, VAT or clearing fees are not included in the prices. We’ll work with our shipping partners to make this process as smooth as possible, but please be aware that you will be required to pay these fees in order to receive your order.

The question for remote area shipping cost.

Shipping cost does NOT include extra costs like remote area shipping fees. Customers may refer to http://www.cn.dhl.com/en/express/shipping/shipping_advice/surcharges.html

to see if you're located in a remote area with your city’s postal code.

Can I get my money back?

Backers can process a refund for their transaction made to a crowdfunding campaign on Indiegogo, provided a campaign is live and not ended, the perk claimed has not been fulfilled, and the funds have not been disbursed to the campaigner.

For campaigns in InDemand, backers can request a refund from Indiegogo within 10 days of the transaction provided the InDemand page is live, the perk has not been fulfilled, and the funds have not been disbursed to the campaigner.

When are contributions not eligible for a refund?

Contributions cannot be refunded by Indiegogo, if any of the following are true:

The contribution funds have already been transferred to the campaign owner

The campaign has ended

The perk associated with the contribution has been fulfilled (Order is marked as fulfilled on Indiegogo by the Campaigner)

story:
Our friend, Dylan Hollingsworth, is an amazing photographer, and all around humanitarian. He dedicates a huge portion of his life to serving others. 

Unfortunately, while covering an election party in Dallas, Dylan's camera bag was stolen, containing several thousand dollars worth of equipment.

You can view Dylan's work here:

http://dylanhollingsworth.com/

http://cowbird.com/dylan/stories/

If you know Dylan, chances are he has been alongside you a time or two, taking pictures of your life, and the lives of those close to you, as it unfolds, in real time, in a very unique way.  Often times, Dylan asks for nothing in return, or, much less than one would normally pay for services from a photographer of his caliber.  In fact, Dylan spends a great deal of his time telling the stories of less fortunate people, stories that might otherwise go ignored.

Here is our chance to return the favor.  We are hopeful that through contributions to this campaign, we can all band together to allow Dylan to continue to do what he does so very well: serve others and tell their stories through the lens of his camera.

Our goal is to raise $2000 in order to help Dylan replace the equipment that was stolen the evening of November 6, 2012, in Dallas, Texas.  Any amount you could possibly contribute would be greatly appreciated!
 
If you aren't in a position to contribute money to this campaign, don't worry!  Help us spread the word by sharing this via Facebook, Twitter, etc.  
 
This entire campaign was created by us, on behalf of Dylan, without his knowledge.  He won't actually find out about it until we go live.
 
We are very grateful for your help!
 
Jordan & Hampton
 
UPDATE - 12/06/2012
 
At Dylan's request, a portion of the donations to this campaign will be contributed to a charity chosen by Hampton, Jordan & Dylan.

story:
MIOPS - Take your photography skills to a whole new level.

MIOPS delivers all of the features required for high-speed photography in a single unit and provides advanced features via a total integration with the smart-phone platform. It will make taking creative photos so easy that you will have the opportunity to reveal your skills with great shots. MIOPS will be your favorite photography equipment.

MIOPS is not the first trigger in the market, but it is going to be the best one. You can control MIOPS with your smart-phone over Bluetooth. You can adjust the settings using dedicated smart phone application and send them to MIOPS with a simple click on your phone.You can either use MIOPS for basic functions like high-speed and lightning photography, but you can also let him perform complex scenarios like combining different modes in the same setup. If you don't want to use a smart-phone, you can always configure MIOPS using the on-board buttons and colorful LCD screen. MIOPS will have an upgradable firmware. It will be open to new features and upgrades will be free for life-time. You will be able to charge MIOPS with any USB charger. It will be light weight, compact sized and compatible with most of DSLR cameras.

Special thanks to Alexander Heinrichs for taking this great photo for us!

I'am excited, tell me more!

MIOPS is a standalone, small factor device which can trigger your camera or flash unit. It has three different sensors; light, sound and laser. MIOPS uses these sensors to detect external events such as lightning, fireworks, popping balloon or a laser beam cut by an obstacle, just to name a few. When such an event is detected, it triggers your camera or flash unit. MIOPS has an input port where you can hook up external sensors as well. You can for example hook up a pressure sensor and use the pressure as a triggering event. It is possible to program MIOPS so that it will take a picture whenever someone steps on your door mat. You just need to place a pressure sensor under the mat and connect it to MIOPS. There are so many different sensors out there and this means you have unlimited options as well to demonstrate your creativity with MIOPS.

MIOPS is not bigger than a credit card and only less than an inch in thickness. It is also light weight and consumes very little space in your camera bag. This is especially important if you carry your other heavy equipment in your bag. MIOPS has a colourful LCD screen and easy to use interface. You can configure your device using the on-board buttons and the screen. It gets even easier if you do this over your smart-phone. MIOPS has Bluetooth capability and with its dedicated smart-phone application you can configure MIOPS without even touching it. All of the device settings are also available on the application. On top of the basic modes and settings, the smart-phone application offers other features like cable release modes and scenario processing mode where you can define event scenarios using the combination of the different sensors. You can for example create a custom scenario like this: I want the sound mode to be activated after the sunset. You configure this using the application and the scenario is sent to MIOPS over Bluetooth connection. Afterwards, you can take your phone and go away, MIOPS will take care of the rest. It does not need the smart-phone to be close by to operate. You can store the scenarios in the application and reuse them whenever you want. You can store up to three scenarios and each of them can check against up two five different conditions measured by all of the sensors. MIOPS is Bluetooth 4.0 compatible, so it is energy efficient, has great coverage and is compatible with iOS and Android smart-phones with Bluetooth 4.0.

A mini-USB port has been added to MIOPS and it serves two important purposes. First of all, you can charge your MIOPS over this USB connection. You can also use a compatible USB charger or you can even charge it in your car just as you charge your cell phone. The rechargeable battery of MIOPS will last for days, it has energy saving features so you don't have to charge your battery very often. The second purpose it serves is the firmware upgrade. MIOPS will have an upgradeable firmware, so you can have new features with the release of new firmware. You will be able to download the new firmware and upgrade your MIOPS within a few minutes.

High speed photography can be tricky sometimes. In some cases, you will need to trigger your flash unit, not your camera. In order to cover this, MIOPS has two dedicated outputs, one is for the camera and the other one is for the flash unit. You can use them separately or at the same time. They are electrically isolated from each other, so there is no risk of a short circuit. Also, each output isolates MIOPS from your camera or flash unit optically. This means in fact there is no electrical connection between your camera and MIOPS at all. One end of the connection cable goes to the remote shutter release port of your camera and the other ends goes to MIOPS. The cables are exchangeable, you can use your MIOPS with different cameras. You don't need to buy an extra unit for your second camera. MIOPS is compatible with most of the major makes and models. You just need to get the proper cable for your other camera. The interface of the cable connection is a standard 2,5 mm jack. Extension cables are commonly available in the market if you have a different setup in your mind where the camera has to stay far away from MIOPS. The same is also valid for the flash unit connection. It uses the standard 3,5 mm connection. Some DSLR cameras do not have a remote shutter release port, instead of this they can be triggered with an IR remote controller. If you own such a camera, you are also covered. MIOPS can trigger your camera with IR connection as well.

Which Operation Modes Does MIOPS Have?

MIOPS is a high-speed camera trigger with multiple modes combined in a single box with all built-in sensors. In order to use the available modes of MIOPS, you don't need to add anything else. Everything is already in the unit and ready to use. Switching between different modes is just a matter of a few clicks and it happens in seconds. It has basically six different modes, let's see them all.

LIGHTNING

Even this mode is called lightning, there is actually so much more about it. Lightning is only one of the events that MIOPS can detect with its light sensor. When the lightning strikes, MIOPS detects in a few nanoseconds and triggers your camera. There is virtually no delay other than the lag time of the camera. MIOPS is well fast enough to capture bolts which stay visible for about 100 milliseconds. You don't need to keep your finger on the shutter release button without knowing when it is going to strike again. MIOPS will detect it and it will help you take the perfect picture. You can adjust the sensitivity of MIOPS in this mode. If you want to capture the biggest bolts only, you can set it to low sensitivity. If you set it to a high level sensitivity, it will even detect the smallest strikes which are usually not noticed by human eye. Fireworks is another great event to capture using MIOPS. The idea is the same with lightning strikes. You can maybe come up with other light events to be captured with MIOPS, we have only named two of them.

Special thanks to Bryan Snider for taking this great photo for us!

LASER

MIOPS can detect laser beams as well and they make the detection of so many events possible. The idea is very simple. If the laser beam is broken, then there must be something happened. And most of the time something happens in milliseconds, but it is not a big deal for MIOPS. The laser beam is so thin, even a water drop can break it. This is how MIOPS detects that the water drop is falling down and then it triggers the camera at the perfect time. This is almost impossible to do with human reflexes. Laser mode can also be used to detect the presence of people, animals or anything bigger than a water drop. This means you detect almost anything. One of the most common uses would be a photo trap. You know a wild animal is in the area and you want to take a picture of it. You never know when it will be coming back, but you don't need to. You can set up a laser source and MIOPS so that the laser beam will be broken when the animal walks through the beam and MIOPS will trigger the camera at that moment, or better said whenever you want it to be triggered. You can add some delay to the process. MIOPS can also turn your camera into a surveillance device. If an intruder breaks the beam, MIOPS will trigger your camera and you will have a picture on the intruder. Have a look at the following bullet!

Is it too fast? MIOPS doesn't think so!

SOUND

When it is all about high-speed photography, sound mode is the mode where things get serious. This is the essential mode to take high-speed pictures in a controlled studio environment. Even MIOPS is fast enough to take pictures of bullets or arrows, your camera is not that fast. Average DSLR camera has a lag time of about 50 milliseconds. This is too long if your objects fly by in a few milliseconds. The sound mode of MIOPS does the trick. You prepare your setup in a completely dark room and bring your camera into bulb mode. As it is completely dark, the camera will not capture anything. What is needed? Light. What delivers the light in a dark room? A flash unit. This is why MIOPS triggers your flash unit instead of your camera. The built-in microphone of MIOPS detects the sound event and triggers the flash unit. When the flash unit is fired, the camera will capture a single frame. This is how you can eliminate the lag time of the camera and capture a real high-speed picture of the object. The main parameter of sound mode is the delay. Delay is the duration starting from the sound event until the flying object gets there where you want it to be. Using the application or the device menu of MIOPS, you can set any delay between 0 ms up to 999 ms. You can also adjust the sensitivity of sound mode. It will allow you to tweak your setup per your creativity.

It is not a bottle anymore :)

TIMELAPSE

When it comes to MIOPS, it is not just sensors. In timelapse mode, MIOPS does not use any sensors but it benefits from the electronics and software to take sequential pictures within a time period with equal time difference between each of them. You can also specify the exposure of the pictures just per your wish. After you have adjusted your parameters, MIOPS will take care of the rest. You can do the adjustment on MIOPS itself or you can also use the smartphone application to configure MIOPS. You can set the interval anywhere between one second and an hour. As MIOPS has energy saving features like turning the LCD off, you can shoot timelapse photography for days without recharging. If you can supply MIOPS with an external power source, you can expect it to last for months depending on the capacity of the power source. Timelapse photographs have to be taken with great precision as it shows moving object and they will be at a different place in each picture. If the time difference between each frame is not consistent, you cannot get good result in time lapse photography. MIOPS is capable of taking the pictures with great precision no matter how long it takes to do this. And this yields to high quality timelapse videos where everything is moving around smoothly. MIOPS takes care of the difficult part and the time lapse video software does the rest. Check the following video if you are curios of how a timelapse video looks like.


HDR 

HDR (High Dynamic Range) photos look to good to be true because they are actually not. Digital processing of the same picture with different exposures is the main idea behind it. It is again done with picture processing software but it is the quality of the single pictures which makes a great HDR picture. MIOPS does here again a fantastic job by achieving highest precision and providing the best time savings. After you have specified the center exposure and step up/down numbers, MIOPS triggers your camera exactly per the settings. You don't need to do anything manually. MIOPS takes the overall control of your camera and does not stop until it gets the job done. Imagine that you had to change all the settings for each of the HDR pictures. It wouldn't be so much fun for sure. On top of that, it would take quite long time to complete all these features. MIOPS eliminates all this hassle by completing everything per your settings with zero manual involvement. It couldn't get easier.

External Port

MIOPS offers unlimited creativity not just with the built-in sensors and software but also with the capability of connecting external sensors as well. If you have a high-speed photography project in your mind which uses another type of sensor, this is not a blocker for MIOPS. MIOPS can accept signals from external sensors with the dedicated port, so you are not limited to light and sound events only. There are many different sensors in the market. Temperature, pressure and humidity sensors are only a few of them. If they are electrically compatible (which means the output signal must be between 0 and 3V) you can connect them to MIOPS. You can use the humidity sensor for example, to trigger the camera if the humidity level is above 65%, or you can hook up a pressure sensor to initiate lightning mode only if the air pressure is low. Every other sensor adds something to your creativity with MIOPS. In fact, MIOPS can actually trigger unlimited type of devices as well. The triggering mechanism of MIOPS is not limited to DSLR cameras and flash units at all. You can trigger any other device which has a trigger port like your DSLR camera. You can use it for early warning system in a farm. If MIOPS detects any lightning activity, it can trigger a siren or warning mechanism, so no live stock remains outside. This kind of usage is quite different from high speed photography, but it is possible with the versatile design of MIOPS. The next section is even more interesting.

Special thanks to Tim Rice for taking this great photo for us!

Advanced Scenarios with the Combination of Multiple Sensors

The app brings the functionality of MIOPS to the ultimate level. On top of the basic modes (Lightning, Sound, Laser, Time Lapse, HDR and External Port) it adds a very cool feature called "Scenario". What does this mean? In this mode you can create a custom scenario with up to five different steps. In each step, MIOPS can use either the same or a different sensor. The result will be a totally unique set-up with sequential steps utilizing one or more sensors for the overall scenario. The following example will make everything clear. Let's say you are going out, but you know that there will be a thunderstorm tonight. You want to take lightning pictures so bad, but you have to leave. Here MIOPS is your saver with Scenario feature. You will add the following steps to your custom scenario:

* First Step: Let's say you want to start taking pictures after the sunset. In such a case you can add any amount of delay before initiating the action. You add the required delay until sunset, so MIOPS knows exactly when to start. If time is up, MIOPS will execute the second step.

* Second Step: You want to do some time lapse photography, just to see how the storm builds up. You define your timelapse parameters including interval, exposure and total period. MIOPS triggers your camera to take all of the required pictures for timelapse and when it is done it will move to the third step.

* Third Step: Now it is time to start lightning photography. MIOPS is ready to capture all of the lightning strikes as it has already waited until sunset and taken all these timelapse pictures. All have been done as you were away enjoying your night. This is just an imaginary example of what you can do with the scenario mode. When we say unlimited creativity, we really mean it. MIOPS has all of the required capability and flexibility to provide this. You can store up to three different scenarios in your smart-phone. They will be ready to use instantly. You can modify them anytime if you want to do something different.

Smartphone Compatible & Bluetooth

We have added the essential features of MIOPS to the device menu, so they can be easily configured and used on the device with no need to another tool. On the other hand, the real potential of MIOPS is revealed with the smartphone application (app). The app offers many advantages and features. First of all, you can take the total control of your MIOPS with the app. Any mode and any parameter can be adjusted with the app and then you can send the settings and commands to MIOPS with a single touch over Bluetooth connection. If MIOPS is mounted on your camera or tripod, you can leave your setup as it is and control MIOPS without even touching it. You will not need to adjust your setup again, nothing will move at all. Your smartphone has a big screen and MIOPS app uses it for your good. You don't need to look at the screen of MIOPS, everything is in your smartphone. The app needs to connect to MIOPS to send the settings only, at all other times you can use your phone with no interruption. MIOPS does not require the control of the app once the settings are received. If you want to switch to another mode, just open the app, connect to MIOPS and switch to another mode. It is so easy.

Project Timeline

We have passed almost all of our critical milestones. Now we need your help to clear off the remaining items.


Backers Plan

We offer a flexible plan for our backers. You can back us with 3 different packages as shown below.
story_txt:
MIOPS - Take your photography skills to a whole new level. MIOPS delivers all of the features required for high-speed 
photography in a single unit and provides advanced features via a total 
integration with the smart-phone platform. It will make taking creative 
photos so easy that you will have the opportunity to reveal your skills 
with great shots. MIOPS will be your favorite photography equipment. 
MIOPS is not the first trigger in the market, but it is going to be 
the best one. You can control MIOPS with your smart-phone over 
Bluetooth. You can adjust the settings using dedicated smart phone 
application and send them to MIOPS with a simple click on your phone.You
 can either use MIOPS for basic functions like high-speed and lightning 
photography, but you can also let him perform complex scenarios like 
combining different modes in the same setup. If you don't want to use a 
smart-phone, you can always configure MIOPS using the on-board buttons 
and colorful LCD screen.
MIOPS will have an upgradable firmware. It will be open to new features 
and upgrades will be free for life-time. You will be able to charge 
MIOPS with any USB charger. It will be light weight, compact sized and 
compatible with most of DSLR cameras. Special thanks to Alexander Heinrichs for taking this great photo for us!
I'am excited, tell me more! MIOPS is a standalone, small factor device which can trigger 
your camera or flash unit. It has three different sensors; light, sound 
and laser. MIOPS uses these sensors to detect external events such as 
lightning, fireworks, popping balloon or a laser beam cut by an 
obstacle, just to name a few. When such an event is detected, it 
triggers your camera or flash unit. MIOPS has an input port where you 
can hook up external sensors as well. You can for example hook up a 
pressure sensor and use the pressure as a triggering event. It is 
possible to program MIOPS so that it will take a picture whenever 
someone steps on your door mat. You just need to place a pressure sensor
 under the mat and connect it to MIOPS. There are so many different 
sensors out there and this means you have unlimited options as well to 
demonstrate your creativity with MIOPS.MIOPS is not bigger than a
 credit card and only less than an inch in thickness. It is also light 
weight and consumes very little space in your camera bag. This is 
especially important if you carry your other heavy equipment in your 
bag. MIOPS has a colourful LCD screen and easy to use interface. You can
 configure your device using the on-board buttons and the screen. It 
gets even easier if you do this over your smart-phone. MIOPS has 
Bluetooth capability and with its dedicated smart-phone application you 
can configure MIOPS without even touching it. All of the device settings
 are also available on the application. On top of the basic modes and 
settings, the smart-phone application offers other features like cable 
release modes and scenario processing mode where you can define event 
scenarios using the combination of the different sensors. You can for 
example create a custom scenario like this: I want the sound mode to be activated after the sunset.
 You configure this using the application and the scenario is sent to 
MIOPS over Bluetooth connection. Afterwards, you can take your phone and
 go away, MIOPS will take care of the rest. It does not need the 
smart-phone to be close by to operate. You can store the scenarios in 
the application and reuse them whenever you want. You can store up to 
three scenarios and each of them can check against up two five different
 conditions measured by all of the sensors. MIOPS is Bluetooth 4.0 
compatible, so it is energy efficient, has great coverage and is 
compatible with iOS and Android smart-phones with Bluetooth 4.0.A mini-USB port has been added to MIOPS and it serves two important 
purposes. First of all, you can charge your MIOPS over this USB 
connection. You can also use a compatible USB charger or you can even 
charge it in your car just as you charge your cell phone. The 
rechargeable battery of MIOPS will last for days, it has energy saving 
features so you don't have to charge your battery very often. The second
 purpose it serves is the firmware upgrade. MIOPS will have an 
upgradeable firmware, so you can have new features with the release of 
new firmware. You will be able to download the new firmware and upgrade 
your MIOPS within a few minutes.High speed photography can be 
tricky sometimes. In some cases, you will need to trigger your flash 
unit, not your camera. In order to cover this, MIOPS has two dedicated 
outputs, one is for the camera and the other one is for the flash unit. 
You can use them separately or at the same time. They are electrically 
isolated from each other, so there is no risk of a short circuit. Also, 
each output isolates MIOPS from your camera or flash unit optically. 
This means in fact there is no electrical connection between your camera
 and MIOPS at all. One end of the connection cable goes to the remote 
shutter release port of your camera and the other ends goes to MIOPS. 
The cables are exchangeable, you can use your MIOPS with different 
cameras. You don't need to buy an extra unit for your second camera. 
MIOPS is compatible with most of the major makes and models. You just 
need to get the proper cable for your other camera. The interface of the
 cable connection is a standard 2,5 mm jack. Extension cables are 
commonly available in the market if you have a different setup in your 
mind where the camera has to stay far away from MIOPS. The same is also
