story_txt:
Meet the LitraTorch

 *The LitraTorch is Patent Pending. 

 
Torch Features and Specifications
 

 

Show Me the Light!



 
Show me the PERKS!
Take a look below to see which perk best fits your lifestyle and lighting activities.  Individual accessories and additional purchase options will be listed in the BackerKit after the campaign is over.

Post Campaign Accessory Add-Ons
In addition to the above perks, when the campaign is over you will receive a survey to confirm your selected perks. At that time you will have the opportunity to purchase additional perks and the below accessories.

Get Cash Back on the Projects You Love!The Vision
We set out to create the world's brightest and most versatile, adventure ready LED light. A light that could keep up with unbridled creativity and imagination. A light that would enable amazing moments never before captured in low or no light conditions.
Our mission was to create a:

Best in class mobile light for photo and video professionals
Best in class light for everyday tasks at home, at work, with a smart phone and for walking and biking
Best in class light for outdoor enthusiast and extreme athletes

A key design criteria was to make sure the light could go anywhere a GoPro Session 4 (and now 5) camera can go - literally! 

Fit into the GoPro Session Frame and GoPro mounting system
Match or exceed waterproof and drop test specifications
Light beam angle complements camera lens' wide angle
Match battery life

Torch design goal was to go anywhere GoPro Camera can go AND fit into the GoPro and traditional camera mounting systems Torch design goal was to go anywhere GoPro Camera can go AND fit into the GoPro and traditional camera mounting systems
We wanted to make the Torch the "Swiss Army Knife" of lights so we designed in:

TWO 1/4 20 standard camera mounts to allow for flexible mounting orientations
MAGNET built into the body to quickly mount to a car hood, tail gate, pole etc
FILTERS for photographic, dive and mood effects = serious photos or serious fun!
SOFT LIGHT with a diffusion cap for a lantern like glow
QUICK CLIP for a simple and secure way to mount to a belt or backpack

The Journey
Over the past 2 years we have hit all our milestones. We started with defining the MRD (Marketing Requirements Document) and progressed all the way through final design, validation testing and release for tooling.  The major R&D events and expenses are complete.

 

 
The Torch "Boot Camp" Video

Pro Surfer and GoPro Ambassador, Anthony Walsh, provides design feedback. Anthony put Torch prototypes through 4 months of punishing testing while surfing Hawaii, Australia, Fiji and Indonesia.

story:
The Short Story:

We’ve all heard the saying “A picture is worth a thousand words.”  Well in some cases, it can be worth much more – a photograph can be the means to a way out of a life limited by blindness and poverty.

I’m a photographer from Squamish BC, and in the new year I will be travelling to Cambodia to volunteer with Seva Canada, an international development organization restoring sight and preventing blindness in 12 of the poorest countries in the world.  I will be capturing images that show Seva’s work in Cambodia, which they will then be able to share in order to raise awareness and generate funding.  

Photography is storytelling.  And visual imagery is the best way to help individuals understand the hardships faced by blind people and their families in these poor and remote areas, as well as the impact that donors can have when they get involved.  I want to help Seva tell these stories.  And I’m hoping you can help me do that.

It’s all happening very soon – we are due to leave the first week of January!  I need to raise $3000 to cover travel expenses.  So I’m turning to you amazing people to help me help Seva.  

In exchange, I’m offering some awesome perks – limited edition block mounted prints, a hard cover book of my images from Nepal, beautiful Paperblanks journals, even a personal photo shoot.  Your contribution will help me get to Cambodia so that we can share the story of how the power of sight transforms lives.

Even if you are not able to contribute, it would mean a lot to me if you could share this page and spread the word! 

Many thanks!

Ellen


The Back Story:

Two winters ago, I travelled to Nepal with Seva Canada, an organization working to eradicate preventable blindness and provide access to eye care to those most in need - women, children and people living in extreme poverty and isolation. 

I photographed patients as they arrived at eye camps and eye hospitals, had their vision assessed, received treatments, and regained their sight - and ultimately an opportunity for a better life.

According to the World Health Organization, restoring a person’s sight is one of the most cost-effective health interventions to break the cycle of poverty.

Blindness can deprive a family in so many ways. A blind person cannot work, and often a spouse or a child bears the burden of their care, meaning they also cannot work or attend school. Restoring vision to just one person positively impacts many, as individuals can then earn an income, support their families and attend school, ultimately benefitting the entire community.

The images that I captured for Seva have been used in various media to both raise awareness and generate funding in order for them to achieve their vision. The work that Seva is doing is truly remarkable.

As a photographer who has full vision in only one eye, I feel particularly connected to this cause. It was extremely moving to witness people being given their vision back and to experience their overwhelming gratitude for this gift.

This time I have been invited to photograph Seva's programs in Cambodia. It means so much to me to be able to support this organization in a tangible way. I feel honoured to volunteer my time and services to help Seva meet their objectives.  I hope you'll join me in lending whatever support you are able.


The Impact:

From Deanne Berman, Marketing & Communications Director for Seva Canada:

Ellen’s photos have helped Seva tell the story of our work overall and specifically in Nepal. We have used her inspiring photos in our print and email appeals to donors, our catalogues, our legacy brochure, our annual report, on seva.ca and in reports to both individual and corporate donors on how their money was used. Ellen’s photos have been included in presentations worldwide including at the International Agency for the Prevention of Blindness annual conference where Seva presented on gender and blindness.
We have used Ellen’s photos in our media kit to educate and persuade journalists to cover Seva’s stories. In fact, Ellen’s images were used in Seva’s proposal to the media to come on a journey with us to Nepal resulting in both Canadian Living and a freelance journalist for the Vancouver Province joining us.
And our donors loved Ellen’s photos so much that we decided to use them to create a set of greeting cards available for purchase to share with friends and family. We also created Gift of Sight cards featuring her photos that have an automatic donation included so donors could give them as gifts.
Ellen’s images have helped us in our efforts to raise funds, gain awareness and tell our story. Her photographic style is inspirational, impactful, and genuine. We hope she can continue to inspire Canadians to give the power of sight through her photography and help end avoidable blindness, ridding the world of a debilitating, poverty inducing condition.



Other Ways You Can Help:

As you've probably noticed, we don't have a lot of time to meet this campaign goal! 

I would be super grateful for anything you can do to help get the word out….


Use the Indiegogo share tools (in the first section of this page) to 

* generate an email to send to your contacts

* like and share this campaign on your Facebook page

* tweet about it

* link to it wherever you can!

Make some noise!  I need your help to make this happen!



More About the Perks:

The Paperblanks Journal - Paperblanks journals are made from acid free paper derived from sustainable forest pulp.  They look like this:


The Greeting Cards - include envelopes and look like this:


The 8.5 x 11 Print - a signed print of this image:


The Hard Cover Nepal Photo Book - still in the works… will feature images captured in Nepal.  To view more of my images from Nepal, many of which will be included in the book, click here.


The 13 x 19 Block Mounted Print - an archival print mounted onto a wood block, ready to hang. This is a bigger, limited edition of the "Monks sitting under prayer flags at the birth place of Buddha, Lumbini, Nepal"  as seen above.


The Series of Three 13 x 19 Block Mounted Prints - archival prints mounted onto a wood block, ready to hang.  Images to be determined…


The Shoot - A private photo session for you and your sweetie….or your kids... or your dog... or your pet rock… whoever you choose.  Includes a print of your favourite image from the session.

story:
Try to think to pick the Instagram App icon and try to make a real camera…

This is the main idea at the base of Instagram Socialmatic Project.

I want to pick some points
1) 50.000$ is for project startup and to allow "us" to have a real good partner to finalize the project;
2) Your contribution will be used to guarantee you a massive discount on final price of the Camera and to create the first crowd sourcing based photo camera!
3) Final price of the product need to be under $350;

----

Since Facebook has bought Instagram for nearly a billion dollars in cash and stock, many users, bloggers, economy experts have thought Instagram could build its first real photo camera.

So, that's is!

Socialmatic is the first Instagram photo camera, with a lot of amazing features:

- 16 GB mass storage;
- Wifi and Bluetooth;
- 4:3 touchscreen;
- 2 main lens, first for main capture, second for 3D filters, webcam applications and QR Code capturing;
- Optical zoom;
- Led Flash;
- Internal printer to make your Instagram photos real;
- Paper cartridge with Instagram Paper Sheets;
- Dedicated 4 colors ink tanks;
- InstaOs 1.0, which put together Facebook and Instagram App feature;
- Pairing with iPhone and Android App;

Take your shoot with Instagram Socialmatic, make your photo cool as you want and share it directly on Facebook trough the powerful InstaOs.

If you want, you can print it directly on Instagram Paper Sheets, thanks to the internal printer.
Every Instagram printed photo reports on front side your Instagram nickname and a QR code, to be followed by another Instagrammer, simply pointing his/her Socialmatic on your printed QR Code.

This because Instagram Paper Sheets has a retro side with a glue strip, just like a post-it.
You can share in the real world your photo, printing your emotions and sensations.

And if you want, on the bottom of front side of your printed photo, you've a dedicated space to write something, just like to comment a photo on Facebook, but in the real world...Do you remember the old Polaroid photos?

Instagram Socialmatic is only a concept...
But, maybe, it could became real...

story:
Peace. My name is Joshua Asante. I am a photographer and musician. I frame and document incessantly. In my melodic life, I am a guitarist and vocalist. In my visual striving, I am primarily a portrait photographer. I began shooting 15 years ago when a friend and mentor gifted me my first "real" camera. I'd already exposed countless rolls of film from throw away cameras. Today, my cameras are an extension of me; as essential as any limb when it comes to self expression. Two days ago my primary camera(The Grocery Gun) was stolen. I've spent the last couple days feeling stupid for being careless enough to let it happen. But, I also have been disoriented by the absence of camera and the certainty it represents. I've always been a bit put off by crowd funding, but with deadlines approaching and clientele being stalled, I realize that I could use some help.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • I need to raise $2500.00 to cover the cost of the camera body and the lens that was attached at the time; this amount also includes standard damage protections. 
  • Contributors will receive a range of visual goodies depending their contributions; including portrait sessions, museum quality prints, high quality card stock prints, tee shirts and even a private musical performance or two. Yep, sangin' for the Canon. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Even if you can't contribute financially, you can still help. Please feel free to pass the campaign along to anyone possibly interested in helping, i.e. that rich uncle that always smells like garlic. Trust, he wants to help. 
  • Be certain to use the IndieGoGo share tools. It's the easiest way to pass the word along.

story:
2 things you should know. 

1.) Rhino Arc II is the most full featured motion control device in its class. You're not going to find something better under $5K. 

2. ) You can get 10% off Rhino Arc II and its accessories if you back this campaign and pre-order it. We don't do sales except for Kickstarter campaigns and Black Friday so back the campaign before it's over to make sure you get in :)

 

 

Rhino Arc II is a compact 4-axis motorized pan/tilt/focus head that enables you to capture unreal video and time-lapse shots. It can hold up to 15lbs of equipment (camera + lens + monitor, etc) and can mount to a tripod or to your Rhino Slider. 

 

 

Rhino Arc II automates camera movement for interviews, time-lapses and b-roll to save you time and make sure you get the shot on the first take. 

You can quickly set up multi-point moves with the integrated dual joystick controls. The main joystick controls pan/tilt, and the front joystick controls slide/focus. 

If you're not next to your camera or are in a tight space, you can setup a move with our new Rhino Arc app for iOS devices. 

 

 

Here's some quick bullet points if you don't feel like scrolling through the  info below:

  • 15lb load capacity on pan & tilt
  • Stand-alone functionality lets you replace your fluid head with ultra smooth, repeatable motorized movement
  • Backwards compatible with Rhino Slider EVO and EVO Motor
  • Optional motorized follow focus (Rhino Focus) for making sure you nail focus
  • Optional slider motor (High Torque & High Speed Motor) controls your linear movement
  • Capture day to night time-lapses with Light Lapse (won't be ready on launch)
  • Built-in output for powering your DSLR or Mirrorless (requires optional Rhino Power dummy battery)
  • Built-in 501 plate receiver (includes 501 compatible plate)
  • OLED screen and dual joysticks for live control over all 4 axis
  • iOS app for remotely controlling and more control over keyframes
  • Motorized mounting using its pan motor

Those are just some of the features so keep reading to find out the rest of the details. 

 

Rhino Slider

 

Along with Rhino Arc II, we're introducing an updated Rhino Slider. It still comes in both Carbon (carbon fiber rails) and Pro (stainless steel) models but has been updated to carry heavier loads and operate vertically. We also changed the way it mounts to tripods. 

 

 

We hate setting up gear. That's why we make it quick and easy so we can spend more time filming. The new Tripod Quick Mount system lets you mount your slider from above so you don't have to spin your tripod onto the bottom of it. Better yet, we added two more of these Tripod Quick Mounts to the ends of our 42" Carbon and Pro sliders. This makes setting up a Rhino Slider on two tripods infinitely quicker. 

 

 

Rhino Focus

 

 

When you're moving a camera on a slider, your focus point is constantly changing. Autofocus on cameras is getting a lot better but you still can't control where it's going to snap to. Keyframing focus is essential to be able to focus on what you want when you're moving. Rhino Focus uses a carbon fiber industry standard rod and .8 cinema pitch gears. It also includes rubber focus ring gears to let you use your photography lenses. 

 

 

High Torque Motor 

 

 

Our original EVO motor was a great all-round motor that was quiet and had great speed ranges. It lacked torque though. We're introducing a new High Torque Motor that will allow you to lift up to 10lbs vertically (not including Rhino Arc II). We will still offer a High Speed Motor that has the original gearing of our EVO motor if you want to move faster (you can choose between the two after the campaign is over). 

*the new High Torque motor is not compatible with your old Rhino Motion Controller. You can still use your old EVO motor with Rhino Arc II however. 

 

 

What is a Robotic Camera Assistant?

 

When we looked at our workflow as filmmakers, we realized that we do a ton of different things. We shoot narrative docs, interviews, weddings, Youtube content, and endless b-roll and time-lapses to make it all cohesive. 

 

Our goal with Rhino Arc II is to automate your camera movement so you can focus on telling your story.

 

Keyframe Mode

 

 

The original Rhino Arc could do a 2 point, 2 axis move. Rhino Arc II can do a 5 point, 4 axis move. Use the dual-joystick controls and set your slider position, pan, tilt, and focus and click the joystick. Repeat this up to 5 times and playback with a repeatable, fixed speed move or use the joystick to control the speed of playback. 

 

 

Rack Mode

 

 

You don’t always need a slider but you always need b-roll. That’s why we created rack mode. When paired with Rhino Focus, simply move your camera and set your focus. Move to where you think you’ll pan or tilt and set your focus again. Now, as you move, your focus will automatically rack perfectly as you control your movement in real time with the joystick. Imagine how much time you’ll save nailing focus on the first try.

 

 

Interview mode

 

 

Doing professional interviews is a staple for most freelancers. Adding motion to your camera ups your production value and is a great way to land higher paying gigs. But what happens if your subject changes their sitting position or moves out of focus? With interview mode you can pause the looping slider by touching the joystick on Arc II or in the app and discreetly reframe and refocus without having to setup a new move and risk killing the moment. 

 

 

LightLapse Mode

 

It is so frustrating to have to wait to setup your time lapse until dark or have your time lapse cut short by the sunrise. That’s why we created Light Lapse. Using a light sensor and a new iOS app, you’ll be able to capture day to night, Holy Grail time-lapses with the click of a button. This feature won’t be available on launch but we’ll invite our backers to BETA test it when it’s ready.

Note: We are only launching this feature on iOS to start and we'll prioritize getting Sony A7 cameras supported first. We'll develop for Android and other cameras based on demand. 

 

 

UI and App

 

Having actual physical controls for motion control is super important. What if your phone dies, doesn’t connect, or the app glitches out? Professional work requires extreme reliability. Because of this, you have full control with physical controls to set up Arc. But, some things are just better in an app experience. With the Arc app, you can setup and playback your move using the virtual joystick. You can create up to 5 key frames and scrub through them for real time remote control. We'll have an iOS version available on launch and consider Android if we have enough demand. 

 

 

Rhino Power

 

 

Changing batteries is a pain. Especially when they only last 45 minutes...thanks S**y. that’s why you’re able to power your camera or monitor directly from Rhino Arc. No more changing batteries mid interview or having your camera run out of juice on a long time-lapse.

 

Battery Life

 

 Powering up to 4 motors and a camera takes a lot of power so we built in a massive 60wh battery pack into Arc. It will allow for 5 hours of continuous use with everything powered up and up to 48 hours for time-lapses. If time is tight it charges in less than 2 hours using our ultra fast international charger.

Mounting Plate 

 

 

A lot of filmmakers use the 501 quick release plate for video work so we built a 501 receiver and plate into Arc. The problem with these plates is how to mount them to your camera. We solved this with a easy to access mounting tool built into the receiver. No more looking for keys or coins to mount your 501 plate. Spoiler alert - it doubles as a bottle opener too. 

 

Motorized Mounting

 

Setting up gear is time consuming. So we try to make it as quick as possible. Rhino Arc uses one of its motors to mount to Rhino Slider or a tripod and the mounting tool to snug it in place. 

 

We'll be using Fedex Ground to fulfill your order if you're in the US. For international orders, we're shipping using Fedex International Economy. Normally we use DHL but it was much less expensive to use Fedex this time around. We don't mark up our rates at all and only charge you what it costs us. 

Please note: You are responsible for all Customs/Importing fees/Taxes. If you haven't imported a product from the US before, please check with your local agency to see what your duty/fees/taxes will be. 

Click here to read more about shipping and fulfillment. 

Who are you guys?

Hey guys, we're Rhino. We've been making camera gear for over 8 years. We're known for our high quality, easy to use sliders and motion control gear. This is our 8th campaign. 

We've been dreaming of creating this product since we launched our original Rhino Slider over 6 years ago. It's been a long time coming but we promise it's going to be worth the wait. 

Credits

Filming: Brandon Henricks, Edward Lee

Editing: Edward Lee

Music: Music Bed

Special thanks to Dan at Atlas Lens Co. for letting us use their beautiful anamorphic lenses.
story_txt:
2 things you should know. 1.) Rhino Arc II is the most full featured motion control device in its class. You're not going to find something better under $5K. 2. ) You can get 10% off Rhino Arc II and its accessories if you back this campaign and pre-order it. We don't do sales except for Kickstarter campaigns and Black Friday so back the campaign before it's over to make sure you get in :)  Rhino Arc II is a compact 4-axis motorized pan/tilt/focus head that enables you to capture unreal video and time-lapse shots. It can hold up to 15lbs of equipment (camera + lens + monitor, etc) and can mount to a tripod or to your Rhino Slider.   Rhino Arc II automates camera movement for interviews, time-lapses and b-roll to save you time and make sure you get the shot on the first take. You can quickly set up multi-point moves with the integrated dual joystick controls. The main joystick controls pan/tilt, and the front joystick controls slide/focus. If you're not next to your camera or are in a tight space, you can setup a move with our new Rhino Arc app for iOS devices.   Here's some quick bullet points if you don't feel like scrolling through the  info below:
15lb load capacity on pan & tilt
Stand-alone functionality lets you replace your fluid head with ultra smooth, repeatable motorized movement
Backwards compatible with Rhino Slider EVO and EVO Motor
Optional motorized follow focus (Rhino Focus) for making sure you nail focus
Optional slider motor (High Torque & High Speed Motor) controls your linear movement
Capture day to night time-lapses with Light Lapse (won't be ready on launch)
Built-in output for powering your DSLR or Mirrorless (requires optional Rhino Power dummy battery)
Built-in 501 plate receiver (includes 501 compatible plate)
OLED screen and dual joysticks for live control over all 4 axis
iOS app for remotely controlling and more control over keyframes
Motorized mounting using its pan motor
Those are just some of the features so keep reading to find out the rest of the details.  Rhino Slider Along with Rhino Arc II, we're introducing an updated Rhino Slider. It still comes in both Carbon (carbon fiber rails) and Pro (stainless steel) models but has been updated to carry heavier loads and operate vertically. We also changed the way it mounts to tripods.   We hate setting up gear. That's why we make it quick and easy so we can spend more time filming. The new Tripod Quick Mount system lets you mount your slider from above so you don't have to spin your tripod onto the bottom of it. Better yet, we added two more of these Tripod Quick Mounts to the ends of our 42" Carbon and Pro sliders. This makes setting up a Rhino Slider on two tripods infinitely quicker.   Rhino Focus  When you're moving a camera on a slider, your focus point is constantly changing. Autofocus on cameras is getting a lot better but you still can't control where it's going to snap to. Keyframing focus is essential to be able to focus on what you want when you're moving. Rhino Focus uses a carbon fiber industry standard rod and .8 cinema pitch gears. It also includes rubber focus ring gears to let you use your photography lenses.   
High Torque Motor   Our original EVO motor was a great all-round motor that was quiet and had great speed ranges. It lacked torque though. We're introducing a new High Torque Motor that will allow you to lift up to 10lbs vertically (not including Rhino Arc II). We will still offer a High Speed Motor that has the original gearing of our EVO motor if you want to move faster (you can choose between the two after the campaign is over). *the new High Torque motor is not compatible with your old Rhino Motion Controller. You can still use your old EVO motor with Rhino Arc II however.  
 
  What is a Robotic Camera Assistant? When we looked at our workflow as filmmakers, we realized that we do a ton of different things. We shoot narrative docs, interviews, weddings, Youtube content, and endless b-roll and time-lapses to make it all cohesive.  Our goal with Rhino Arc II is to automate your camera movement so you can focus on telling your story. Keyframe Mode  The original Rhino Arc could do a 2 point, 2 axis move. Rhino Arc II can do a 5 point, 4 axis move. Use the dual-joystick controls and set your slider position, pan, tilt, and focus and click the joystick. Repeat this up to 5 times and playback with a repeatable, fixed speed move or use the joystick to control the speed of playback.   Rack Mode  You don’t always need a slider but you always need b-roll. That’s why we created rack mode. When paired with Rhino Focus, simply move your camera and set your focus. Move to where you think you’ll pan or tilt and set your focus again. Now, as you move, your focus will automatically rack perfectly as you control your movement in real time with the joystick. Imagine how much time you’ll save nailing focus on the first try.  Interview mode  Doing professional interviews is a staple for most freelancers. Adding motion to your camera ups your production value and is a great way to land higher paying gigs. But what happens if your subject changes their sitting position or moves out of focus? With interview mode you can pause the looping slider by touching the joystick on Arc II or in the app and discreetly reframe and refocus without having to setup a new move and risk killing the moment.   LightLapse Mode It is so frustrating to have to wait to setup your time lapse until dark or have your time lapse cut short by the sunrise. That’s why we created Light Lapse. Using a light sensor and a new iOS app, you’ll be able to capture day to night, Holy Grail time-lapses with the click of a button. This feature won’t be available on launch but we’ll invite our backers to BETA test it when it’s ready.Note: We are only launching this feature on iOS to start and we'll prioritize getting Sony A7 cameras supported first. We'll develop for Android and other cameras based on demand.  
  UI and App 
 Having actual physical controls for motion control is super important. What if your phone dies, doesn’t connect, or the app glitches out? Professional work requires extreme reliability. Because of this, you have full control with physical controls to set up Arc. But, some things are just better in an app experience. With the Arc app, you can setup and playback your move using the virtual joystick. You can create up to 5 key frames and scrub through them for real time remote control. We'll have an iOS version available on launch and consider Android if we have enough demand.   Rhino Power  Changing batteries is a pain. Especially when they only last 45 minutes...thanks S**y. that’s why you’re able to power your camera or monitor directly from Rhino Arc. No more changing batteries mid interview or having your camera run out of juice on a long time-lapse. Battery Life  Powering up to 4 motors and a camera takes a lot of power so we built in a massive 60wh battery pack into Arc. It will allow for 5 hours of continuous use with everything powered up and up to 48 hours for time-lapses. If time is tight it charges in less than 2 hours using our ultra fast international charger.Mounting Plate   A lot of filmmakers use the 501 quick release plate for video work so we built a 501 receiver and plate into Arc. The problem with these plates is how to mount them to your camera. We solved this with a easy to access mounting tool built into the receiver. No more looking for keys or coins to mount your 501 plate. Spoiler alert - it doubles as a bottle opener too.  
 
 Motorized Mounting 
 Setting up gear is time consuming. So we try to make it as quick as possible. Rhino Arc uses one of its motors to mount to Rhino Slider or a tripod and the mounting tool to snug it in place.   
 
 
 
 
 

 We'll be using Fedex Ground to fulfill your order if you're in the US. For international orders, we're shipping using Fedex International Economy. Normally we use DHL but it was much less expensive to use Fedex this time around. We don't mark up our rates at all and only charge you what it costs us. Please note: You are responsible for all Customs/Importing fees/Taxes. If you haven't imported a product from the US before, please check with your local agency to see what your duty/fees/taxes will be. Click here to read more about shipping and fulfillment. Who are you guys?Hey guys, we're Rhino. We've been making camera gear for over 8 years. We're known for our high quality, easy to use sliders and motion control gear. This is our 8th campaign. We've been dreaming of creating this product since we launched our original Rhino Slider over 6 years ago. It's been a long time coming but we promise it's going to be worth the wait. CreditsFilming: Brandon Henricks, Edward LeeEditing: Edward LeeMusic: Music BedSpecial thanks to Dan at Atlas Lens Co. for letting us use their beautiful anamorphic lenses.

story:
I'm making this campaign to help fund a new DSLR for the FFcossag Youtube channel, (pssst, it's just arrived - check the updates!) in order to replace the very well-worn Canon EOS 1000D, which, after almost a decade of faithful service, died while capturing timelapse video.


I've got my eyes on a Canon EOS 800D kit, which offers some rather attractive video features, including a fully integrated video timelapse mode - something none of the other blog cameras can do. The price tag at a local retailer comes down to 999 € including tax - which, while quite steep for a sub-10K sub Youtube channel, I find to be justifiable.

I've already placed an order for the camera. 
So, it's happening regardless of how much money this campaign raises. Don't feel any pressure to contribute. The more money we can scrape together, though, the better we can make this camera by adding stuff like a proper mic, spare batteries, and perhaps even a fancier lens.

Thank you for your time and consideration.
FF

story:
THIS IS 70MAI!

The current popular 70MAI Dash Cam on the market is Chinese version, do not support English. English version of 70Mai Dash Cam debuts here, better for English speaker using and better specs.

Recording while driving has never been so simple! 70MAI is an AI powered smart dash cam to meet your requirements that you can’t achieve now while driving.

It can help you to take pictures of scenery, record the beauty on the way, and automatically record the scene of accidents. With 70MAI, all of the above can be achieved HANDS FREE! Which boost your driving safety.  

All our products undergo rigorous testing before release, including several rounds of Beta testing. We provide some test dash cams to famous technology journalist. Here are comments.

CHOOSE 70MAI

SOLVE THESE PROBLEMS

POWERFUL VOICE CONTROL

With your hands on the wheel, where they should be, you can still capture the perfect still shots or videos with just your voice commands. And you can review back the beautiful scenes and happy moments through 70 MAI APP at any time.

 

AI ALGORITHM INTEGRATED

AI integrated is based on extensive data training. Regardless of accents, speech recognition is not an issue. Also, the speedy processor completes the voice commands almost instantly.

 

EMERGENCY RECORDING

When collision happens, 70MAI can automatically record the emergency situation and save the videos separately to event folder. This feature avoids the emergency videos being recovered by normal loop recording. And these emergency videos can be important for police reports, accident reports and insurance claims.

 

APP CONNECTION

By downloading our APP and accessing 70MAI Free Wi-Fi, you can view your dash cam video in real-time.  You can also watch historical footage and even download your important pictures/videos to your cell phone. It's simple and does not use your SIM card.

 

EASY INSTALLATION

You can install 70MAI to your vehicle by simple two steps. The vehicle’s cigarette lighter supplies the power, so 70MAI automatically works when you start the car.

 

HIGHLIGHTS

 

Why 70MAI?

What's In the Box

 

DEVELOPMENT

Prototype & Development

We are ready for mass production

How to connect to your 70MAI Dash Cam?

 

TIMELINE

 

CORE MEMBERS

 

ABOUT US

Banya is a focused and creative team, also a Mi ecosystem company. The team consists of top product engineers, architects and senior technical experts from internet, tele-communications, and automotive industry. We have rich experience and keep trying various possibilities and challenging the functional and technical limits. Through efforts, we will show the highest level of vehicle intelligent products and provide safe, comfortable and networked driving experience to help each driver enjoy the feeling in the car and on the road.

Referral Program

If you refer a backer to our campaign, and they pledge more than one perk, you will get a Sandisk 16GB Micro SDHC UHS-I Class 10 Flash TF Memory Card for free!

The memory card is necessary for 70Mai dash cam to save the recording video. It is on our perk list, costs $8.

There are several ways to win, and we suggest you try them all! There is no share time limits, and the more you share, the higher chance you have of winning a free memory card

Method 1:

Log in to indiegogo, Click these share buttons

Method 2:

Log in to indiegogo, visit 70Mai indiegogo page: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/70mai-smarte...

Find the share button and share directly

Method 3:

In addition to the one click share button, you can also take two steps to refer our campaign to more people:

Step 1: Login your indiegogo account, and go to our campaign page, copy the link with the series number, that’s your unique referral pixel. 

Step 2: Paste that link to anywhere with large viewership, like your emails, facebook groups, Linkedin groups, personal blogs, or some forums, anywhere. The more you share, the better your chance is of winning a FREE Sandisk 16GB Micro SDHC UHS-I Class 10 Flash TF Memory Card.

 

FAQ

  • What is the video spec?

70MAI smart dash cam supports recording videos of 1080P, i.e. the dimension of the video is 1920*1080 pixels.
Every second the dash cam records 30 frames, i.e. 30FPS.

  • What is the image sensor of the 70MAI?

The sensor used by 70MAI  is Sony IMX323.

  • Do I need manually turn on and off the dash cam?

After the dash cam is connected to the cigarette lighter receptacle in the car, you do not need to manually turn on or turn off it. Every time when the car is started (ie, the cigarette lighter port is powered on), the dash cam automatically boots up. The dash cam will turn off automatically when the vehicle is turned off (ie, the cigarette lighter port is powered off).

Some vehicle's cigarette lighter keeps being powered on even when the vehicle has been turned off, in this situation, you need to manually turn off the dash cam. And the next time you start the vehicle, you need to manually turn on the dash cam.

  • How to observe the running status of the dash cam?

Check the status indicator on the side of the dash cam. If the indicator is green, the dash cam is recording normally; if the indicator turns red, it means that the recording is abnormal.

  • What memory card does 70MAI support?

70MAI supports standard Micro SD card (TF card) with the capacity of  16GB to 64GB and speed at Class10 or above.

Make sure you use high-quality storage cards from a known brand. The actual writing speed and capacity of the low-quality storage cards may be lower than declared. Video aren't normally saved to low-quality storage cards. We don't take any responsibility for such cases. 

  • Does 70MAI support firmware update?

Yes you can update the firmware of your 70MAI smart dash cam. Download the update package by the 70MAI App, and push it to the dash cam by Wi-Fi connecting. Next time when the dash cam boots up, it start to update automatically.

story:
Up to date information are available on our brand new website : https://ibubble.camera

We’re underwater world lovers. What we enjoy most is exploring the underwater world, taking in the beauty of the oceans. If you’re like us, you know how cool it is to share your diving experiences with people on land. But you also know how complicated filming can be, how it limits your freedom underwater – and freedom is why we dive in the first place.

With iBubble, we’re designing the first intelligent, user-friendly and completely autonomous diving drone. It gives you unprecedented possibilities to create underwater movies with your GoPro®. From scuba divers to freedivers, but also recreational snorkelers and spear fishers, everyone can enjoy iBubble! 


Thanks to our patented underwater localization technology, iBubble follows you and films entire diving sessions – without you having to do anything. It’s your own pilot fish, but with a camera and smarter.

iBubble opens a whole new (underwater!) world of filming opportunities. You will create shots that were, until today, only accessible with professional means: record what you see from a distance, follow and film yourself, orbit around you and many more. To make sure your footage is perfectly steady despite sudden movements or currents, iBubble will be stabilized. The cherry on top: we will add two 1000 lumen lights to increase image quality.

 

Some close-up shots require precise camera handling: an octopus hiding in a crack for instance. We’ve got that covered too – simply call iBubble back from your bracelet, grab it, switch to manual mode and use it as a regular underwater camera. Press the switch again, release iBubble and it’ll resume following you. 

Not sure what’s under the boat? If you’d rather scout unknown spots from the comfort of the boat before diving, you’ll love our remote control option. Plug it in, immerse iBubble and see for yourself if it’s worth getting wet.

 

The oceans are an awesome gift nature gave us. As respectful visitors of the underwater world, we want iBubble to be part of the solution. We’re designing a drone with minimal footprint, minimal noise and maximum regard for the marine environment. Not only that – we’ll also give 1% of our sales to nonprofit organizations fighting for cleaner oceans.

* This applies to sales after Indiegogo campaign

General

  • Dimensions: 50 x 35 x 25 cm – 20 x 14 x 10 inches
  • Weight: About 5 kg – 11 lbs

Performance and operating conditions

  • Max depth: 60 m – 197 ft
  • Max range from diver: 25 m – 80 ft
  • Battery life: 1 hour in standard conditions (10°C - 30°C or 50°F - 86°F water, 15 min lights usage, 1 m/s or 3.2 ft/s max. current)
  • Top speed: 1 m/s or 3ft/s

Drone

  • Hydrodynamic design with integrated handles for easy transport
  • GoPro® compatible (Hero 3 and up)
  • Proprietary positioning system (patent pending)
  • Inertial measurement unit with 3-axis gyroscope, accelerometer and magnetometer
  • Compatible with GoPro filters 
  • Integrated obstacle detection system 
  • Depth sensor
  • 7 brushless motors for 3D mobility and stability, even in strong currents
  • 2 x 1000 lumen lights
  • Manual mode switch
  • Rechargeable and easily replaceable battery pack (2 x 4S 8000 mAh Li-Po)
  • Automatically resurfaces in case of emergency (permanent signal loss, out of battery…) – with optional “diver to iBubble” tether available  
  • RC with live video feedback (Explorer’s RC Pack only)
  • Easily repairable architecture for authorized dealers 
  • Withstands currents of up to 3 knots (1.5m/s or 5ft/s)

Bracelet

  • Connected bracelet with embedded camera movements, including “come to me” feature
  • Integrated high-visibility display
  • Recording start/stop switch

App

  • iOS/Android app
  • Wireless footage streaming to your smartphone

We started dreaming of iBubble in March 2015. Since then, we’ve refined the idea a lot, both in terms of functionalities and technical specs.

During the product definition stage
We’ve interacted with hundreds of people from the diving community (scuba divers, free divers, underwater movie professionals, scientists…). We’ve gathered user feedback from experts and amateurs. In fact, we’ve leveraged every single opportunity to meet and discuss with our future backers, from huge diving shows to Facebook or face to face meetings. Our motivation was simple: we absolutely needed to know what YOUR dream underwater camera would be. Because we believe that’s the only way to deliver a great product.

On the technical side
We first identified the fields of expertise required to make iBubble work, from hydrodynamics to energy management, via signal processing and embedded software. We then developed a proof of concept (a real-life feasibility test to make sure our technical hypothesis are valid) on the most critical technological breakthrough: underwater positioning. Given that high frequency radio transmission, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth don’t work underwater, we had to find another way to ensure communication between the diver and the drone. We’ve looked at other industries and eventually found a solution mixing the best of marine mammals’ echolocation and computer-based tracking algorithms. For all other required functionalities, we’ve either considered technologies available off-the-shelf, and/or performed preliminary studies to check that we could meet our timeframe, quality and costs expectations. We’ve chosen to develop several prototypes and test our ideas in situ.

  • The technical prototype V5 "Beluga" you can see in the videos is our most advanced one in terms of functionalities. This prototype integrates ultrasonic transmitters that allow to detect the diver 360° around it. Thanks to the connected bracelet, the diver can change the camera angle scenarios or ask to resurface at the end of the dive.
    We also implemented a feature that greatly improves the accuracy of the shots: real-time video recognition. This technology opens many possibilities for the future.
    Great work has been done on the fluidity and the precision of the movements. We are now working on the integration of new scenarios such as the 360°.

  • The yellow prototype is a design mock-up. We wanted you to have an idea of how cool iBubble will look in the future. Its shape takes into account architecture constraints of all functionalities iBubble will have onboard in a slick, hydrodynamic design. Integrating the different technologies is a time-consuming phase, which should be complete at the end of this calendar year.

Regarding the bracelet
We have already developed its critical functionality: the positioning system’s transmitter. You can see its first prototype handled by our diver in the Technical Prototype V5 video above. How does it work? The transmitter emits a low frequency signal that the drone uses to calculate its position relative to the diver. The antenna, battery and electronics included in this prototype seem bulky, but they are design to meet a >1 km (~1 mile) range requirement. Once they are scaled back to iBubble’s 25m/80ft range, they will fit in a dive computer.

We’ve also worked on the bracelet’s future design and user interface. You can see one of the previous rendering in the pictures below. In the future, it will also integrate a display to make it even simpler. To industrialize this bracelet, we will turn to a well-known dive computer manufacturer. Several of them have approached us, and we’ve decided that it would be more efficient to leverage their expertise. Backers updates will inform you regularly of our progress on this front.

What’s next? The product development
We’ve defined a robust methodology based on our extended experience in consumer goods industrialisation and high-end software development. We’ve already pre-selected key partners for both the development and the production phase. You’ll find the main steps of the industrialization process in the timeline below.

We’ve assembled an A-team of passionate divers, underwater world enthusiasts and people with the skills to turn our idea into reality: embedded software developers, manufacturing & supply chain managers for some of largest manufacturers, mechatronics experts, experienced business model designers and creative innovation marketers. We love what we do and do it well!

Our team members have completed projects ranging from critical software for commercial airliners to France’s best selling electric car or Hexo+, the world’s first autonomous flying camera. We’re also working with partners who are leaders in their fields, whether it’s launching startups or turning Indiegogo hopes into successful industrial projects.

Why are we tooting our horn here? Because launching a product from scratch is a difficult process. And we certainly don’t want to mess it up. Truth be told, we want to go diving with iBubble as much as you do! Delivering a product too late or short on functionality is not an option for us.

1. PURCHASING AND SHIPPING

2. FILMING ANGLES, USES AND MODES

3. ABOUT iBUBBLE: ORIGINS, COST, TIMELINE...

4. TECHNICAL SPECS

5. AFTER THE DIVE

6. ENVIRONMENT AND SAFETY

7. WARRANTY

 

1. PURCHASING AND SHIPPING

Where do you ship to?

We will ship to anywhere in the world reachable by a carrier.

How much is shipping?

Shipping is not included for perks including iBubble. Worldwide shipping is $75, regardless of your country. Shipment does not include extra fees from customs, or additional costs associated with your country. For the 25 dollars perk, shipping is included.

Who is responsible for any additional taxes, duties or VAT?

Prices do not include importation taxes. The backer is responsible for them, please check your country's import duties before purchasing.

How does the iBubble deposit perk work?

You simply have to pay $300 now, and the balance before shipping (in May 2018). 

I preordered an iBubble, but I didn’t get a confirmation email. How can I check the status?

Please refer to this article on How to Check if Your Contribution is Successful. If there is still an issue, you may contact us at indiegogo@ibubble.camera.

There was an error with my contribution. What happened?

Please refer to this article on common contribution errors and steps to resolve: Common Contribution Errors.
 

2. FILMING ANGLES, USES AND MODES

What will iBubble do?

iBubble will follow divers underwater, filming quality images autonomously. Several filming modes will be available, including moves impossible for a diver to perform (such as rapid vertical climbs). Divers will easily switch between modes thanks to a convenient control bracelet. iBubble will also feature a manual mode for close-ups. Back to the surface, the divers will produce movies with minimal editing, share them with friends or use them to improve their technique.

Where will iBubble be positioned when filming the diver?

 

The location of the drone will depend on the location of the diver and the filming mode selected.

iBubble's first version will analyze the best angle, keeping the bracelet at the center of the shot. But its wide angle will also capture the surroundings.

 

Which filming modes will be available?

 

  • Follow me: the camera remains near the diver and records what he sees. Marine life, corals, shipwrecks…
  • 360° selfie: the drone completes a full circle around the diver, keeping the person at the center of the shot.
  • Zoom in / Zoom out: smooth transitions between wide-angle views and macro vision.
  • Manual mode: the diver takes a hold of iBubble, to record close-up images for instance.

What can I use it for?

iBubble will be useful to:

  • bring back memories from your underwater adventures
  • share your passion with people on land
  • create stunning movies
  • analyze your dives and improve your technique
  • scout a diving location before your group goes in the water

 

3. ABOUT iBUBBLE: ORIGINS, COST, TIMELINE...

How did you come up with this idea?

iBubble is the brainchild of Kevin Delfour and Xavier Spengler, keen divers, photographers and technology enthusiasts. They were looking for a way to film quality underwater videos without having to deal with heavy and cumbersome equipment. The idea of an autonomous wireless underwater camera imposed itself.

Delfour and Spengler turned to Startup Maker, the startup studio behind Hexo+ (1.3M$ on Kickstarter in 2014). The studio provided a complete business development and marketing support team.

Today, Nicolas Gambini and Benjamin Valtin are respectively CEO and CMO of Notilo+, the company created to support iBubble.

When will iBubble be in customers' hands?

iBubble units will be shipped to customers in May 2018.

Is there already a functioning product?

Between July and December 2015, we’ve developed two technical prototypes to validate the positioning technology closed to the diver. It works well, even if it does not have its final design. By the end of the year, a prototype will integrate the same technology to the design final look, thanks to the funds raised in April.

What's the extend of Guillaume Nery and Julie Gautier’s involvement in the project?

Guillaume Néry is a professional filmmaker as well as a world-class athlete. His partner, Julie Gautier, directed Gravity and other stunning underwater films. We've submitted our idea to them early on. They were taken by it and immediately started contributing to the project. Today, Guillaume Nery is acting as iBubble's ambassador but also helps define technical characteristics, along with Julie Gautier.

 

4. TECHNICAL SPECS

Which cameras are compatible with iBubble ?

For our first version, we are working with GoProⓇ Hero versions 3, 4 and 5.

Tell me about the engines

iBubble is equipped with 7 propellers

  • 4 engines sit in the nozzles, at a 45° angle from the central axle. They propulse the drone forward and backward.
  • 3 other engines enable upward and downward movements, as well as rotations. They also stabilize the drone.
  • Each engine is made of three 2.5” blades which can rotate in both directions.

You say that iBubble will be quiet, can you explain further?

iBubble doesn’t rely on a ballast system, so there are no actual bubbles! In addition to that, the engines are positioned inside the drone, where we’re trying to contain the noise. Our goal is for iBubble to be as discreet as possible. iBubble adapts to the marine environment, not the other way around.

Will iBubble film in low light conditions?

Thanks to integrated LED lights, iBubble will capture quality video, with brightened colors.

How will iBubble react to underwater currents?

This is one of the areas we're focusing on at the moment (along with environmental impact and obstacle avoidance). iBubble is equipped with 8 engines and an inertial unit in order to counteract turbulences. It should be able to go to 3.2 ft/s max and 1.9 knots.

How will the batteries work?

  • iBubble is equipped with a battery pack of 2 LiPo (lithium) batteries lasting up to 1h in standard conditions (10 to 30°C / 50 to 86°F, 15 min lights usage, 1 m/s – 3.2 ft/s max. current)
  • Battery packs can easily be swapped
  • The batteries are encased in a waterproof box

What happens if iBubble runs out of battery?

We are aiming for a 1-hour battery life. When the battery will be nearly empty, iBubble will alert the diver with a set of LED lights. The diver will call iBubble back and hook it on his back. This will be particularly useful for drift dives. Another option will be for iBubble to resurface. This could be useful for longer dives.

What if iBubble loses power or if there is an electrical failure in the water?

When the battery runs out, iBubble will come back to the diver and he will be able to finish the dive with it.  In case of a failure, iBubble is equipped by an emergency system that send it directly to the surface.

How does the signal work underwater?

iBubble “speaks” to the diver via a control bracelet, using Short Baseline (SBL). This is the same low-frequency positioning system used by submarines. We use low power, low frequency signal, which presents no danger to divers or fishes.

How does one carry iBubble on land?

We’re really proud of our design, which takes in consideration feedback from our community of divers. With convenient handles and weighing only 5kg (less than 11lbs), the drone is a breeze to transport on land.

How will you ensure filming quality?

iBubble’s IMU (inertial measurement unit) is very precise and will allow for great stability. The 7 engines also help stabilize the drone. 

Will the images be filtered?

iBubble will be compatible with GoPro camera filters.

 

5. AFTER THE DIVE

I’m done recording. What now?

You will connect your phone, tablet or computer to your iBubble via Wifi or Bluetooth to upload and edit your video!

How should I take care of my iBubble?

Rinse it thoroughly with clear water after each dive and keep it in its case.

 

6. ENVIRONMENT AND SAFETY

What will be iBubble's impact on the marine ecosystem?

Like most divers, we love our underwater world. Therefore, preserving it is high on our priority list. We're crafting a drone that will be surprisingly quiet. This way, it won’t disturb and scare away marine life. The communication between iBubble and the diver works on a frequency and intensity marine mammals can’t be disturbed. The camera uses a sonar (also harmless) to avoid obstacles, be they fishes, corals or shipwrecks.

And what about corals?

Used in normal conditions, our drone will be able to avoid obstacles, i.e. corals, fish, shipwrecks, etc.

What if a shark bites iBubble?

The drone’s colors are picked so that they don’t attract predators (i.e. by avoiding strong contrast).

What if 3 divers in the same group have an iBubble?

Each drone responds to its own bracelet. One diver won’t be able to control another diver’s iBubble.

 

7. WARRANTY

Will iBubble come with a warranty?
Yes, there will be a 1 year warranty for some parts. It won’t include the propellers, the dome, the handles, the beacons and improper use of the drone (such as depth).
Who would I send my iBubble to for repairs?
Certified iBubble resellers will be listed on our website. Look for the one nearest you.
story_txt:
Up to date information are available on our brand new website : https://ibubble.camera
We’re underwater world lovers. What we enjoy most is exploring the underwater world, taking in the beauty of the oceans. If you’re like us, you know how cool it is to share your diving experiences with people on land. But you also know how complicated filming can be, how it limits your freedom underwater – and freedom is why we dive in the first place.
With iBubble, we’re designing the first intelligent, user-friendly and completely autonomous diving drone. It gives you unprecedented possibilities to create underwater movies with your GoPro®. From scuba divers to freedivers, but also recreational snorkelers and spear fishers, everyone can enjoy iBubble! 







Thanks to our patented underwater localization technology, iBubble follows you and films entire diving sessions – without you having to do anything. It’s your own pilot fish, but with a camera and smarter.


iBubble opens a whole new (underwater!) world of filming opportunities. You will create shots that were, until today, only accessible with professional means: record what you see from a distance, follow and film yourself, orbit around you and many more. To make sure your footage is perfectly steady despite sudden movements or currents, iBubble will be stabilized. The cherry on top: we will add two 1000 lumen lights to increase image quality.
 





Some close-up shots require precise camera handling: an octopus hiding in a crack for instance. We’ve got that covered too – simply call iBubble back from your bracelet, grab it, switch to manual mode and use it as a regular underwater camera. Press the switch again, release iBubble and it’ll resume following you. 





Not sure what’s under the boat? If you’d rather scout unknown spots from the comfort of the boat before diving, you’ll love our remote control option. Plug it in, immerse iBubble and see for yourself if it’s worth getting wet.


 

The oceans are an awesome gift nature gave us. As respectful visitors of the underwater world, we want iBubble to be part of the solution. We’re designing a drone with minimal footprint, minimal noise and maximum regard for the marine environment. Not only that – we’ll also give 1% of our sales to nonprofit organizations fighting for cleaner oceans.


* This applies to sales after Indiegogo campaign





General

Dimensions: 50 x 35 x 25 cm – 20 x 14 x 10 inches
Weight: About 5 kg – 11 lbs

Performance and operating conditions

Max depth: 60 m – 197 ft
Max range from diver: 25 m – 80 ft
Battery life: 1 hour in standard conditions (10°C - 30°C or 50°F - 86°F water, 15 min lights usage, 1 m/s or 3.2 ft/s max. current)
Top speed: 1 m/s or 3ft/s

Drone

Hydrodynamic design with integrated handles for easy transport
GoPro® compatible (Hero 3 and up)
Proprietary positioning system (patent pending)
Inertial measurement unit with 3-axis gyroscope, accelerometer and magnetometer
Compatible with GoPro filters 
Integrated obstacle detection system 
Depth sensor
7 brushless motors for 3D mobility and stability, even in strong currents
2 x 1000 lumen lights
Manual mode switch
Rechargeable and easily replaceable battery pack (2 x 4S 8000 mAh Li-Po)
Automatically resurfaces in case of emergency (permanent signal loss, out of battery…) – with optional “diver to iBubble” tether available  
RC with live video feedback (Explorer’s RC Pack only)
Easily repairable architecture for authorized dealers 
Withstands currents of up to 3 knots (1.5m/s or 5ft/s)

Bracelet

Connected bracelet with embedded camera movements, including “come to me” feature
Integrated high-visibility display
Recording start/stop switch

App

iOS/Android app
Wireless footage streaming to your smartphone




We started dreaming of iBubble in March 2015. Since then, we’ve refined the idea a lot, both in terms of functionalities and technical specs.
During the product definition stageWe’ve interacted with hundreds of people from the diving community (scuba divers, free divers, underwater movie professionals, scientists…). We’ve gathered user feedback from experts and amateurs. In fact, we’ve leveraged every single opportunity to meet and discuss with our future backers, from huge diving shows to Facebook or face to face meetings. Our motivation was simple: we absolutely needed to know what YOUR dream underwater camera would be. Because we believe that’s the only way to deliver a great product.
On the technical sideWe first identified the fields of expertise required to make iBubble work, from hydrodynamics to energy management, via signal processing and embedded software. We then developed a proof of concept (a real-life feasibility test to make sure our technical hypothesis are valid) on the most critical technological breakthrough: underwater positioning. Given that high frequency radio transmission, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth don’t work underwater, we had to find another way to ensure communication between the diver and the drone. We’ve looked at other industries and eventually found a solution mixing the best of marine mammals’ echolocation and computer-based tracking algorithms. For all other required functionalities, we’ve either considered technologies available off-the-shelf, and/or performed preliminary studies to check that we could meet our timeframe, quality and costs expectations. We’ve chosen to develop several prototypes and test our ideas in situ.


The technical prototype V5 "Beluga" you can see in the videos is our most advanced one in terms of functionalities. This prototype integrates ultrasonic transmitters that allow to detect the diver 360° around it. Thanks to the connected bracelet, the diver can change the camera angle scenarios or ask to resurface at the end of the dive.We also implemented a feature that greatly improves the accuracy of the shots: real-time video recognition. This technology opens many possibilities for the future.Great work has been done on the fluidity and the precision of the movements. We are now working on the integration of new scenarios such as the 360°.
The yellow prototype is a design mock-up. We wanted you to have an idea of how cool iBubble will look in the future. Its shape takes into account architecture constraints of all functionalities iBubble will have onboard in a slick, hydrodynamic design. Integrating the different technologies is a time-consuming phase, which should be complete at the end of this calendar year.

Regarding the braceletWe have already developed its critical functionality: the positioning system’s transmitter. You can see its first prototype handled by our diver in the Technical Prototype V5 video above. How does it work? The transmitter emits a low frequency signal that the drone uses to calculate its position relative to the diver. The antenna, battery and electronics included in this prototype seem bulky, but they are design to meet a >1 km (~1 mile) range requirement. Once they are scaled back to iBubble’s 25m/80ft range, they will fit in a dive computer.
We’ve also worked on the bracelet’s future design and user interface. You can see one of the previous rendering in the pictures below. In the future, it will also integrate a display to make it even simpler. To industrialize this bracelet, we will turn to a well-known dive computer manufacturer. Several of them have approached us, and we’ve decided that it would be more efficient to leverage their expertise. Backers updates will inform you regularly of our progress on this front.
What’s next? The product developmentWe’ve defined a robust methodology based on our extended experience in consumer goods industrialisation and high-end software development. We’ve already pre-selected key partners for both the development and the production phase. You’ll find the main steps of the industrialization process in the timeline below.


We’ve assembled an A-team of passionate divers, underwater world enthusiasts and people with the skills to turn our idea into reality: embedded software developers, manufacturing & supply chain managers for some of largest manufacturers, mechatronics experts, experienced business model designers and creative innovation marketers. We love what we do and do it well!
Our team members have completed projects ranging from critical software for commercial airliners to France’s best selling electric car or Hexo+, the world’s first autonomous flying camera. We’re also working with partners who are leaders in their fields, whether it’s launching startups or turning Indiegogo hopes into successful industrial projects.Why are we tooting our horn here? Because launching a product from scratch is a difficult process. And we certainly don’t want to mess it up. Truth be told, we want to go diving with iBubble as much as you do! Delivering a product too late or short on functionality is not an option for us.

story:
Thank you so much for Joseph Kaiser's video!

Referral Program

Media

Overall

What is Inrigo?

Inrigo is a fully waterproof camera-carrying backpack that provides alerts when dangerous levels of moisture are detected. 

Why use it?

Moisture is an unseen killer of camera equipment. Hot or cold weather, rain or rivers, all of them bring risks to expensive camera gear. Inrigo solves this problem by being airtight and alerting you via Bluetooth if unsafe levels of moisture are detected.

How do you use it?

Keeping your camera gear safe is as easy as inserting the Bluetooth moisture monitor and closing Inrigo's airtight zipper. 

Industrial grade material keeps the water out – but if moisture or humidity jump,  Inrigo's  Bluetooth-connected app will alert you via smartphone. 

How waterproof is it?

Inrigo uses double-sided TPU, a hybrid between plastic and soft silicon, along with an airtight zipper. The interior is fully insulated from outside humidity. Inrigo meets IP78 waterproof guidelines, meaning it can safely be immersed in one meter of water for 30 minutes. 

Is the quick-open zipper safe?

Yes. The zipper only opens when given a strong pull from both sides – perfect for photographers that need quick access to their cameras. It is fully waterproof.

Ergonomic Design

Adjustable and padded, the ventilated back fits your body, moving perspiration while letting you wear Inrigo in comfort. The suspension system distributes weight evenly, meaning long hikes won’t result in shoulder pain.

Remotely detect moisture

Inrigo includes a Bluetooth humidity sensor that pairs with your cell phone, alerting you when unsafe levels of humidity are detected. If you leave your backpack behind, you will also be sent a message reminding you you've gone out of range.

The right Inrigo for you

We provide two different packages: the Inrigo LitePak and Inrigo ProPak.

The Inrigo LitePak is a fully functioning Inrigo without inner carrying bags. Perfect for those who want to continue using the camera case they are familiar with.

The Inrigo ProPak comes with two inner-cases designed to hold two cameras and five lenses. 

Pump it up

Inrigo is designed to float and also comes with a valve allowing you to pump air into the backpack, providing an extra level of protection from impact.

On the road or on the river

Unlike most "waterproof" camera bags on the market that just offer partial protection against water and humidity, Inrigo complies with IP78 waterproofing standards, the same as the Apple Watch.

Inner bag details

Upper inner bag details

Bottom inner bag details

Goodbye dry box

Serious camera owners have long turned to dry boxes, large, water safe containers kept at home. With Inrigo, your dry box has become mobile and ready to go at a moment's notice.

Support us and get these perks.

Inrigo timeline

Is this product perfect for a friend? E-mail support@micronovelty.com for a link and earn a free air pump.

Risks and challenges

We’re no strangers to Kickstarter projects and the challenges involved. While we recognize unforeseen events may pose a challenge, we have a proven record of delivering on the products we aim to produce, including successful design, production and delivery of the CASE smart camera remote (caseremote.cc).

We already have multiple working samples, but we still need more time and funding to produce Inrigo at scale. Once we hit our goal, manufacturing and delivery should face minimum challenges.

We have confidence in our supply chain, but shipment can at times be tricky – issues can arise with too much demand, delaying delivery. Border customs can also cause issues, possibly resulting in a few days delay. We will be transparent and provide updates if such issues arise.

We are ready to meet and possibly exceed our schedule.

The suspension system distributes weight evenly, meaning long hikes won’t result in shoulder pain.Remotely detect moistureInrigo includes a Bluetooth humidity sensor that pairs with your cell phone, alerting you when unsafe levels of humidity are detected. If you leave your backpack behind, you will also be sent a message reminding you you've gone out of range.The right Inrigo for youWe provide two different packages: the Inrigo LitePak and Inrigo ProPak.The Inrigo LitePak is a fully functioning Inrigo without inner carrying bags. Perfect for those who want to continue using the camera case they are familiar with.The Inrigo ProPak comes with two inner-cases designed to hold two cameras and five lenses. Pump it upInrigo is designed to float and also comes with a valve allowing you to pump air into the backpack, providing an extra level of protection from impact.On the road or on the riverUnlike most "waterproof" camera bags on the market that just offer partial protection against water and humidity, Inrigo complies with IP78 waterproofing standards, the same as the Apple Watch.Inner bag detailsUpper inner bag detailsBottom inner bag detailsGoodbye dry boxSerious camera owners have long turned to dry boxes, large, water safe containers kept at home. With Inrigo, your dry box has become mobile and ready to go at a moment's notice.Support us and get these perks.Inrigo timelineIs this product perfect for a friend? E-mail support@micronovelty.com for a link and earn a free air pump.Risks and challengesWe’re no strangers to Kickstarter projects and the challenges involved. While we recognize unforeseen events may pose a challenge, we have a proven record of delivering on the products we aim to produce, including successful design, production and delivery of the CASE smart camera remote (caseremote.cc).We already have multiple working samples, but we still need more time and funding to produce Inrigo at scale. Once we hit our goal, manufacturing and delivery should face minimum challenges.We have confidence in our supply chain, but shipment can at times be tricky – issues can arise with too much demand, delaying delivery. Border customs can also cause issues, possibly resulting in a few days delay. We will be transparent and provide updates if such issues arise.We are ready to meet and possibly exceed our schedule.

story:
About Me

Simple pleasures are my main focus.  I enjoy expanding my experience by interacting with people and the natural world around me.  My ambition is to help the world see the beauty that already exists, and if I can be a vehicle for that, then I will be able to die a happy man.

Most people know me as a simple person; I value experience over material acquisitions, relationships over associations, and fun over stress... which I believe most people would agree with. 

I have been passionately shooting photos for the past 15 years.  I feel very fortunate to have found something that allows me to share some of the beauty I find in this world.  

What I need

Last month my camera bag and all my gear was stolen.  I did not have insurance and lost everything.  I was just getting going with a blossoming photography career, and had received much encouragement from peers and family as having a good talent and eye.

So basically I need to raise money to get my gear, and am hoping by offering some good perks you will see the value in my work, and feel good knowing that by purchasing some good art that you will be helping someone get back to doing what they love.  My perks have two themes:

  • Physical artwork for your desk or wall that I hope you will enjoy - all photos are unmanipulated (except for some lightroom adjustments), but I do my best to keep the image to resemble what my mind's eye saw at that time.
  • Tutorials on photoshop and lightroom to help you increase your knowledge of these software programs to hopefully further your own photography pursuits.

The Impact

The impact will be real:  you will help someone be able to get back doing what they love.  I am not a fan of loans and do not want to rely on the bank for this project.  Instead, I hope that I can do a bit of "reverse selling" where people can exchange money for some quality prints that will look great, or make for excellent gifts.  

The funds raised will go toward the purchase of a new camera body, lenses, tripod, bag, memory cards, and accessories.  Any additional money will be invested in gear, and if you know the photography game, it can get expensive.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share with your network of anyone who appreciates good art or is looking to further their own photography career with lessons on lightroom and photoshop.  I would be extremely grateful if you can spread the word so that this project can actually happen.  

You can see all the photos that are available to claim as a reward here:  http://500px.com/steveandrews

when you claim your prize just let me know which ones you'd like and I'll hopefully have everything out by christmas! 

Thank you for your time!

story:
Heyheyhey!!!

I’m Aaron St. Bernard from Everything Is A Model. For years I’ve passionately photographed and documented numerous events I attended for coworkers, friends and family. I’m currently completing Digital Photography courses at George Brown College and I’m just about ready to begin my new career as a professional photographer.  I was born and raised in Toronto, Canada and I relish documenting the artistry in and around my city and cities around the world. I am fascinated by elegance and simplicity in everything around me and I believe that anytime is the perfect time for a photo shoot.  I intend to use photo journalistic style to cover events such as weddings, birthdays, graduations as well as concerts, fundraisers, and serious events such as demonstrations and protests in the streets. I will share these stories through digital media and hopefully through publication in the future.  More importantly I will be able to employ myself and hopefully help other amateur photographers start their own businesses to be independent.

Step 1, I need a new camera! Mine was stolen in Chicago (along with some great photos!), and this is why I need your help.

I’m purchasing a new laptop, and paying for the photography courses and I’m finding the cost of this plus a new camera overwhelming. I need to raise $1,500 to cover the cost of a Canon 60D camera and basic accessories. As such, I’m turning to my strongest supporters to ask for contributions.

In exchange for your generous contributions, I’m offering thank you’s, shout outs, love, photo prints, photo books, and photo shoot sessions! Check out the website http://everythingamodel.wordpress.com/

(If you prefer to recieve a print that isn't 8x10I'm willing to negotiate!)

All and any contribution amount will help me raise the target $1500, and further, it will help me launch a new career as a self-employed photographer!

If you can't help out with a pledge then maybe you could help me out by sending this to someone who can/will/could. Make some noise!

Many thanks!

Aaron St. Bernard

story:
As filmmakers, we at Blindspot have been creating screen content for decades and we know lighting is essential to the look and quality of the end result.  

 

When we source kit, we’re looking for rugged durability - filming can be tough on your gear! That's why we've made the Tile Light with a full metal jacket made from adc12 aluminium. On IndieGogo get the Tile Light now. The first batch starts shipping now. 

The Tile Light is perfect for remote locations, documentary, cinematography, product reviews, bloggers, video marketing...the list goes on. Pocket-sized and hand luggage friendly, this feather-weight contender can go with you anywhere.

The Tile Light has an incredible soft box that will be sold separately. 

 

 

Easily attachable Gels, they stick directly to our single surface emitter.  

This is the retail version of the Tile Light, the version that will end up in the shops and online. It includes everything you could want to operate this incredible new light.

  1. Tile Light
  2. Protective pouch
  3. Remote Dimmer Unit
  4. Travel AC
  5. Battery adapter
  6. Battery(NP-F550)
  7. Battery charger
  8. Ball mount
  9. Hot shoe adapter
  10. CTO Gel

All this for £495 inc VAT

 



 

 

 

 

 

FOLLOW BSG on Twitter@blindspotgear or LIKE our Facebook page! 

 

Risks and challenges

 

We have spent the past 12 months developing this product which is now shipping. We have delivered our first Kickstarter orders and will be shipping consistently over the next month. There is very little risk to purchasing now.
