story:
*English subtitles are available, you can turn them on when watching!

 

On the BONZART ZIEGEL, we don't want to just add in a simple video function, we want the videos taken with our camera to have the same vibe as to how we take photos. That's why our video mode will also come with the 8 color modes.

 

 The BONZART ZIEGEL, purely for the joy of capturing a picture wherever inspiration strikes. An easy point and shoot mechanism, perfect for your style.

The compact body, easy access to buttons and simple operation, offer a thrilling creative experience. Take outstanding photographs that are true to your senses and unique perspective.  

 

  

 

The compact body and the streamlined control interface are designed to reduce the distance between you and the camera, evokes the excitement of holding and operating a camera.

 

 

Above all, we want you to enjoy the freedom to express your senses, creativity and style. BONZART ZIEGEL is not just a tool for taking photos. It is a new way to enjoy photography.  

 

 

 

 

ZIEGEL means “tile” in German.

We purposely avoided the unvaried camera design, the BONZART ZIEGEL has a clean but yet elegant silhouette.

The unique design was inspired by the streamlined design of traditional Japanese rooftops. Using German in our product's name is our tradition, it is a tribute to the long history of famous Germany camera brands. That is why we took the German word "ZIEGEL" as the name of this new member of the BONZART family. 

 

 

An abundant amount of buttons and dials was placed on the back of the camera to arouse your curiosity when operating it. 

 


 

 

 

BONZART ZIEGEL offers three color variations: Black, Turquoise and Rose.

 

 

You can also think of the front of BONZART ZIEGEL as a small curved canvas for you to unleash your creativity. 

Spruce up your camera with decoration stickers that come with the package. You can also use markers to draw on the front or even use beads and studs to decorate the front side, making it gorgeous, punk or wild as you wish.

 

Stickers are included in the package.

 

Design examples, decorations are not included.

 

Front Color Parts are easily removable.  Get the Front Color Parts as Add-ons(US$23) for customizing to the special looks.

 

 

 

 

 

The BONZART is not only a camera, but it is also an accessory to up your styling game.

A 6mmφ strap wheel on the top of the camera is compatible with most camera straps and carabiners. Its compact 8cm x 9cm body makes it versatile enough to be carried with one hand, on your shoulder, around the neck or even hooked on your bag or belt loops! Show off your BONZART ZIEGEL in a way that best suits your style.  

 

 

 

 

You may have taken innumerable shots with a host of cameras and smartphones. But the BONZART ZIEGEL is softer, simpler and more unique than any other photography tool that you’ve ever used.

 

 

Shooting with BONZART ZIEGEL is very simple with no tedious initial setup, and the camera uses AA battery so you never have to charge it.

In contrast to the easy setup, there are various functions and modes on the BONZART ZIEGEL that invites you to dive deeper into photography.

 

 

 

The shooting format can be selected from a normal 4:3 aspect ratio, 1:1 squared ratio or 16:9 cinematic ratio.

 

 

 

 

BONZART ZIEGEL features 8 color modes, you can switch between different modes easily with the dial. Have fun combining the modes with other settings like exposure and white balance to produce unique expressions.

 

 

 

Capture the natural beauty of the subject organically.

 

 

 

Creates a powerful atmosphere with vivid color and high contrast with a touch of blue.

 

 

 

Emerald green filter and high contrast to create a fantasy atmosphere.

 

 

 

Yellow base with a hint of grey and red, gives you a distinct sense of nostalgia. 

 

 

 

Black and white filter with strong contrast and vignettes to create an urban image. 

 

 

 

Deep sepia and vignette effect, a mysterious historic finishing.

 

 

 

Two gradations of black & white produce a sharp image that gives you a sense of playfulness.

 

 

 

A retro blue shade, dyeing the image into an old movie poster-like vibe. 

 

 

 

 

 

BONZART ZIEGEL is equipped with two types of frames reminiscent of film photography, the 35mm and 120mm.

Each frame comes with three versions: 1. film counter + logo, 2. film counter + logo(black & white version), 3. Plain version

Only 4: 3 aspect ratio with 5 megapixels or less is supported when shooting with these two frames.

 

 

Signature sprocket hole photography with 35mm film.

 

 

 

Negative film of medium format photography.

 

 

 

 

Touch panels can easily be found on many devices, we are used to operating with touch controls, but BONZART ZIEGEL insists to embrace physical buttons.

Switching between colour effects, frames, digital zoom or EV, most options can be accessed without opening a menu.

We believe that by doing so we can create a user experience as fun as we have experienced with the portable gaming devices during the 1990s.

 

 

 

 

Double exposure is also available and can easily be done with the camera's double exposure mode.

Unleash your ideas and inspiration, you can create an abnormal world with a simply by pressing the shutter twice.

 

 

 

A LED ring light that can be adjusted from two levels of brightness is mounted around the lens.

 

 

With the LED ring light, you can shoot in situations where there is little to no light. 

 

 

Give your photos a unique touch with manual colour customization with our filter plates. Simply slip in the plate on the LED ring light, it fits perfectly and securely locks in place.

 

 

The LED ring light can be switched on without turning on the camera in case you need a temporary light source. 

 

 

 

Dive deeper with the BONZART ZIEGEL 2-in-1 conversion lens. Shoot wide-angle with the whole lens, remove the top part to use as a macro lens.

 

 

 Shoot wide-angle

 

 

Shoot macro by removing the top of the lens.

 

 

Combining the macro mode with the LED ring light can make a huge difference when taking close up shots.

 

(Left)LED ring light OFF, (Right) LED ring light ON

 

The BONZART ZIEGEL 2-in-1 conversion lens can be purchased as Add-on(US$48).

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

BONZART is a new camera brand born in Tokyo in 2012.

We created BONZART AMPEL in 2012. It is the world’s first twin-lens digital camera, inspired by the twin-lens reflex camera. It was sold worldwide as a miniature-styled camera that uses optical processing, featured in The Wall Street Journal and many other media.

The BONZART’s philosophy is to produce camera with unique design, simple operation and ability to stimulate playfulness. 

 

 

Cameras are no longer a necessity for anyone who wishes to casually take photos as smartphones can easily do the job. While major camera brands are focusing on making professional cameras with super high-end quality and performances. BONZART has its own category that aims to create a new style of cameras that does not follow trends. 

 

 

 

 

Dear all,

Hello everyone. We are very excited to introduce the new BONZART camera to everyone around the world.

Since we launched our first original camera BONZART AMPEL in 2012, we have been working in Tokyo as a unique toy camera speciality store that sells both our own cameras and various toy cameras. And in 2016, we started developing a new camera so that not only Japan but everyone around the globe can enjoy the fun of toy cameras.

About 4 years from the start of this project. Within the limits, such as the appearance design of the camera, the atmosphere of the photos that can be taken, and the user experience, we have been through a rapid trial and error process to make the camera more usable and more enjoyable.

 

 

For BONZART, a toy camera is about design, fashion, art, sometimes a little distraction, or magic that transforms your everyday into something else completely. Above all, you can have fun using just a camera, without any specialized knowledge or techniques. With this in mind, we continue to make detailed updates to the BONZART ZIEGEL.

 

 

If you need more sample photos shot with the camera, please take a look at BONZART's official Instagram account. Our photos were taken by the creators themselves and are updated daily. All photos are made only with the camera and our lenses.

 

 

Probably the present age is an era where we take more photos than ever since the camera was invented. I personally use a variety of cameras according to the situation, such as single-lens reflex cameras, smartphone cameras, sometimes even action cameras. I also process photos with numerous editing software and applications.

BONZART ZIEGEL is a new proposal from us after our experience with all sorts of cameras and tools. If you're a photographer with a high-end camera, you can enjoy a little break with our camera. If you've only taken pictures with your mobile phone, you can easily enjoy the fun of operating a camera with BONZART ZIEGEL. Also, if you like crafting and painting, you can even create a one-in-the-world unique camera.

How to enjoy BONZART ZIEGEL is completely up to you. We would be happy if you were pleased.

Creative Director – Koshiro Tokuhashi

 

 

*The original delivery was in July 2020, but due to the COVID-19 situation and the lockdowns, our original manufacture and deliver schedule were greatly affected. But since the factories are now back on business, we are working hard to deliver the product in December 2020.

That's why our video mode will also come with the 8 color modes.  The BONZART ZIEGEL, purely for the joy of capturing a picture wherever inspiration strikes. An easy point and shoot mechanism, perfect for your style.The compact body, easy access to buttons and simple operation, offer a thrilling creative experience. Take outstanding photographs that are true to your senses and unique perspective.      The compact body and the streamlined control interface are designed to reduce the distance between you and the camera, evokes the excitement of holding and operating a camera.  Above all, we want you to enjoy the freedom to express your senses, creativity and style. Using German in our product's name is our tradition, it is a tribute to the long history of famous Germany camera brands. That is why we took the German word "ZIEGEL" as the name of this new member of the BONZART family.   An abundant amount of buttons and dials was placed on the back of the camera to arouse your curiosity when operating it.     BONZART ZIEGEL offers three color variations: Black, Turquoise and Rose.  You can also think of the front of BONZART ZIEGEL as a small curved canvas for you to unleash your creativity. Spruce up your camera with decoration stickers that come with the package. story:
Varför insamlingen?

Redaktionen vill nu satsa mer på video och fältreportage och vi startar därför en insamlingskampanj för att finansiera köpet av en ny videokamera med professionella mikrofoner.

Investeringen kommer att möjliggöra fler tv-produktioner med både fältreportage och intervjuer och annat med betydligt högre kvalitet och professionalitet än tidigare.

Redaktionen arbetar fortfarande huvudsakligen ideellt men för att kunna göra ett bättre jobb och starkare intryck behöver vi bättre verktyg. Det är viktigt att vi gör ett seriöst intryck i fält och önskar därför stöd ifrån er läsare med denna investering.

Detta vill vi köpa:

  •     2x Canon XA30, videokameror
  •     Kamerastativ
  •     Intervjukit med myggor
  •     Fältmikrofon för reporter
  •     Extra batteri

Vårt uppsatta insamlingsmål är 30 000 kronor.

Detta vill vi leverera:

  •     Fler och bättre reportage
  •     Bättre ljud och bildkvalitet
  •     Professionellt intryck i fält
  •     Snabbare produktioner

 

Tack för ert stöd!

Markus Andersson, chefredaktör

story:
It's taken me a while, and the urging of friends, to get up the courage post this.  I believe in working hard and that there is no free lunch.  Leaving my business, moving, and becoming a stay-at-home mom (working part-time as a photographer) was a hard adjustment.  Even though the most rewarding, it was also the hardest work I've ever done and there was no paycheck to boot.  

Last fall, my townhome was broken into and all my camera equipment, which I had collected over a decade, was stolen.  I had hoped to repurchase at least one camera and lens before the new year, but life (babies, medical emergencies, kids' camps, electronic school supplies etc.) happened and it was not possible.

So, I'm offering a trade.  Any money you can give towards a camera and lens (Canon 5D Mark iii and 24-70mm 2.8 lens with 82mm filter, the same models that were stolen) will be a credit for a photography session with High Street Photography, or you can let me know of an image you would like (i.e. something for your walls) and I will take it and send you the hi-res image.  

I love photography, and losing my cameras was like losing a limb.  I have a prosthetic (my phone), but taking pictures with that is a bit like trying to draw fine art with a charred stick.  As soon as I have enough to re-buy my camera and lens, I will start booking sessions immediately! 

Whether or not you contribute, thank you for taking to time to stop by.  Keep pursuing your own dreams and don't let anything stop you.  Life is beautiful.

$65 Perk - Hand-Screenprinted Tee with our Bike Life or Java Life designs!

$100 Perk - Personal stencil!

$395 Perk - Full digital session with High Street Photography!

story:
Who I am:

 

My name is Will Tanksley. I'm an Italian-American from the Hudson River Valley of New York. I attended Fordham University in New York City and earned a BA in fine arts specializing in photography and painting.

What I'm doing:

I have been living and photographing in the Philadelphia area for 2+ years, and have the same camera I learned on through my college years. (A beautiful Canon Rebel Xt). Cameras have made quite some progress since then. Most Iphones and Ipads now have comprable/better sensors and I find much of the work I do in low-light settings to be sub-par for this reason. As I attempt to make phorography more than just a passion or a hobby, I need to invest in this and other pieces of equipment to produce and print a better, more professional and polished image.

What I need:

My goal is the current price for Canon's EOS 6D, which boasts one of the best low-light sensors. 

However, I realize that this investment for just one piece of equipment isn't wise. So, unless I exceed this goal, I am going to use the funds to buy a cheaper, but comprable alternativee, the EOS 60D which is 700$

The rest of the funding will go to the rest of the equipment I need which includes:

lighting - parabolic reflectors and diffusers, a larger lightbox, angled and/or remote flash

gear  - new zoom lens, lens shade, extra battery pack, more backdrop colors, tripod, memory cards, and a new backup terrabyte drive

printing - I'd also like to start producing physical prints to frame and sell, as well as for headshots. This requires photo paper, ink, and of course, a high quality photo printer like Epson's Stylus Photo R2000 which goes for 500$

 

What I hope to achieve:


Seeing as this campaign ends on my 25th birthday, I'm hoping to start the next quarter-century of my life on the right track to earning a living from what I take pleasure in doing. High quality images and video are some of the best tools to document and promote, showcase the amazing things people do and create and I'd like to prvide that for my community.

story:
Sometimes, perfect photo opportunities can pass by in a flash. We’ve all been there: we spot something we’d love to photograph but by the time we’ve grabbed our SLR out of the bag, adjusted the focus and framed the shot, the moment has passed. Or we might use our smartphone to take a quick pic but the resolution just isn’t great.

Our solution?

We want to produce a professional-grade lens that will put the “Insta” back into Instagram! We want to bring the spontaneity back to photography while maintaining the highest standards of photo creation.

The C.P. Goerz CITOGRAPH 35 is a revolutionary type of lens – the next big thing in photography. The angle of view corresponds with your natural viewing angle.

Watch the world around you, take part and capture the crucial moment without hesitation or delay. No holding back: there are no mechanics in the lens to slow you down so you’re always ready to shoot.

 

The CITOGRAPH 35mm is the world’s first ever hyperfocal citography lens, designed to capture a unique moment in time, just as YOU see it. The camera sees what you see. All you need to do is hold up your camera and snap away. Instantly. In the moment. 

 

There is no autofocus, no zoom, no adjusting your aperture. Thanks to a fixed aperture and hyperfocal technology, everything from 3m to infinity is automatically in focus. The Tessar-type lens gives you great sharpness and is packed into a hyper-flat lens design that is both cool and innovative.

The lens gives you endless opportunities to express yourself and create a personal photo diary of your surroundings as you experience them through your own eyes. Support our campaign to help us make this vision a reality.

Citography is a completely new form of spontaneous and pure photography, allowing you to create beautiful and highly professional photos of the world around you – create images that are just as unpredictable and spontaneous as life around you.

With the CITOGRAPH 35mm, you can truly express yourself and tell your very own story – from your own unique viewpoint, without compromising on image quality. It offers a creative freedom that has so far not been possible in photography.

It is the perfect universal lens for this new way of documenting life – citography. With a focal length of 35mm, the possibilities are almost endless: it strikes the perfect balance between a standard-angle and wide-angle lens. And thanks to its hyperfocal technology, you can take stunning pictures of fast-moving objects – talk about capturing a fleeting moment!  

 

About me

“I’ve been working in photography for over 25 years. Street and portrait photography are my two biggest passions and my work has taken me all around the world. I am not a big fan of ‘staging’ my pictures, I’d rather capture the world around me as it is and use different techniques to put my unique spin on it. 
The 35mm focal length is ideal for this kind of photography. And I always use an f/8 aperture to achieve the best possible image depth. 

So far, other lenses have always been either too bulky for me, or the autofocus took too long when trying to take a spontaneous photo. On top of that, most lenses don’t have an exact focus range. So I ended up missing out on a lot of photo opportunities. 

This is how the idea of the CITOGRAPH 35mm was born. With its fixed focus, I am always ready to take instant, high-quality snapshots. The lens is also extremely compact – it easily fits into my bag and goes with me everywhere! And thanks to the large sensor, the CITOGRAPH takes amazing pictures even in low light.” 

C.P.Goerz is a duly incorporated company in Atlanta Goergia.  The company has been newly formed and shares no legal obligations with the former C.P.Goerz in the US. The reason to form C.P.Goerz Inc. in the US was that it makes it easier for the US and international costumers, because we can offer our goods in Dollar and sthe costumer and the company have no currency risk.

We have chosen a Tessar-type lens. This lens construction is known for its sharpness but can also be built in a very compact manner which was key to our mission. It has the necessary basic sharpness and contrast required to create those expressive images.


We made the lens super easy, no technical background is needed. But here is a little information on how to use it:

Set your ISO setting to automatic and select “time automatic”. That’s it! You’re ready to go and create your own citography world. You won’t miss anything around you anymore.

 

How is the color applied?

By adding colored particles the specific colored look is obtained to last for a lifetime.

.

 

The Citograph 35 was developed by a german independent engineering firm according to our specifications

Specs

  • Focal length 35 mm 
  • Magnification ratio 1:8 
  • Optical construction 4 elements in 3 groups 
  • Field of view +/- 31° 
  • Distortion ≤ 1% Light loss max. 27 % 
  • Focussing 3m bis ∞ 
  • Filter thread M 37 x 0,75 
  • Dimensions Ø 58 mm x 23 mm 
  • Weight ±. 120g 

 

The lens will be available with mounts for:

  • Canon EF
  • Nikon
  • Pentax PK
  • Sony E
  • Leica M
  • Micro Four Thirds
  • Fuji X

 

 

History:

C. P. Goerz was founded in 1886 by Carl Paul Goerz. The purpose of the company was to establish a business for mail-order trade of mathematical instruments. Just a year later, cameras were included in the assortment. With the takeover of the workshop of F.A. Hintze, the company began to produce cameras under the name of “Optische Anstalt C.P.Goerz” and, from 1890 on, the production of lenses followed. The outstanding quality of the C.P.Goerz lenses quickly spread and in 1894 C.P.Goerz was awarded the golden medal for excellent camera lenses at the world exhibition in Antwerp. This award is today comparable to an Oscar in technology.

The young Emil van Höegh joined the company in 1892 and took over the management of the production, as well as the international sales management. Under his leadership, the world-famous lenses Dagor, Goerz-Hypergon and also the Höeghsche meniscus were introduced.

The „Photographische Rundschau“ wrote in 1899:

„A rapid upswing occurred in 1893, when the double anastigmat calculated by Mr. von Höegh, the scientific employee of the company, came onto the market. The company became so immense that the workshop had to be moved into a large factory building. „

For Carl Georg Schillings, the pioneer of animal photography and nature conservation, C.P.Goerz even developed special designs.

C.P.Goerz lenses were built at other locations around the world under license agreements. In New York in 1902, the first branch was established, and in the same year the C.P.Goerz was converted into a stock corporation. The company also opened offices in London, Paris and St.Petersburg. Through 1911, 300,000 lenses were produced and the number of employees rose to 2,500 and later to 12,500. C.P.Goerz was one of the world’s leading optical manufacturers.

In Europe, C.P.Goerz merged with other companies in 1926 to form Zeiss Ikon AG. In the US, on the other hand, the Goerz American Optical Company continued to focus on the development and manufacture of film lenses. Because of the high quality of Goerz lenses from 1939 onwards Bolex, at that time the leading manufacturer of 16 mm film cameras, equipped their cameras with lenses made by the C.P. Goerz American Optical Company.

In 1972, the C.P.Goerz American Optical Company merged with Schneider-Optics and Goerz thus disappeare

 

 

Shipping information:

We will ship your rewards worldwide from Germany. For backers inside the European Union: VAT is not included and has to be added on your end. So please add 19% to your total pledge amount including shipping. Please note there may be extra import costs/customs/taxes to pay upon delivery, depending on your location. Customs and taxes are subject to possible change and applicable law at the time of delivery will have to be taken into account. If you have a question about shipping or handling, please don’t hesitate to contact us! If you have forgotten to add VAT/sales tax to your pledge, you can just raise it as long as the Indiegogo project is live.

 

Risks and Challenges

Before starting this campaign, we have finished the first prototypes and already funded the project via another croudfunding platform. Additionally we have planned production with potential, competent suppliers.

Now we are ready to kick-off production. The lens will be made in Asia. Although, we have already planned everything very consciously and are working closely with industry professionals, we might encounter problems in the process of production which we cannot oversee by now. This may cause delays in the delivery.
story_txt:
Sometimes, perfect photo opportunities can pass by in a flash. We’ve all been there: we spot something we’d love to photograph but by the time we’ve grabbed our SLR out of the bag, adjusted the focus and framed the shot, the moment has passed. Or we might use our smartphone to take a quick pic but the resolution just isn’t great.Our solution?We want to produce a professional-grade lens that will put the “Insta” back into Instagram! We want to bring the spontaneity back to photography while maintaining the highest standards of photo creation.The C.P. Goerz CITOGRAPH 35 is a revolutionary type of lens – the next big thing in photography. The angle of view corresponds with your natural viewing angle.Watch the world around you, take part and capture the crucial moment without hesitation or delay. No holding back: there are no mechanics in the lens to slow you down so you’re always ready to shoot. The CITOGRAPH 35mm is the world’s first ever hyperfocal citography lens, designed to capture a unique moment in time, just as YOU see it. The camera sees what you see. All you need to do is hold up your camera and snap away. Instantly. In the moment.  There is no autofocus, no zoom, no adjusting your aperture. Thanks to a fixed aperture and hyperfocal technology, everything from 3m to infinity is automatically in focus. The Tessar-type lens gives you great sharpness and is packed into a hyper-flat lens design that is both cool and innovative.The lens gives you endless opportunities to express yourself and create a personal photo diary of your surroundings as you experience them through your own eyes. Support our campaign to help us make this vision a reality.Citography is a completely new form of spontaneous and pure photography, allowing you to create beautiful and highly professional photos of the world around you – create images that are just as unpredictable and spontaneous as life around you.With the CITOGRAPH 35mm, you can truly express yourself and tell your very own story – from your own unique viewpoint, without compromising on image quality. It offers a creative freedom that has so far not been possible in photography.It is the perfect universal lens for this new way of documenting life – citography. With a focal length of 35mm, the possibilities are almost endless: it strikes the perfect balance between a standard-angle and wide-angle lens. And thanks to its hyperfocal technology, you can take stunning pictures of fast-moving objects – talk about capturing a fleeting moment!   About me“I’ve been working in photography for over 25 years. Street and portrait photography are my two biggest passions and my work has taken me all around the world. I am not a big fan of ‘staging’ my pictures, I’d rather capture the world around me as it is and use different techniques to put my unique spin on it. The 35mm focal length is ideal for this kind of photography. And I always use an f/8 aperture to achieve the best possible image depth. So far, other lenses have always been either too bulky for me, or the autofocus took too long when trying to take a spontaneous photo. On top of that, most lenses don’t have an exact focus range. So I ended up missing out on a lot of photo opportunities. This is how the idea of the CITOGRAPH 35mm was born. With its fixed focus, I am always ready to take instant, high-quality snapshots. The lens is also extremely compact – it easily fits into my bag and goes with me everywhere! And thanks to the large sensor, the CITOGRAPH takes amazing pictures even in low light.” C.P.Goerz is a duly incorporated company in Atlanta Goergia.  The company has been newly formed and shares no legal obligations with the former C.P.Goerz in the US. The reason to form C.P.Goerz Inc. in the US was that it makes it easier for the US and international costumers, because we can offer our goods in Dollar and sthe costumer and the company have no currency risk.We have chosen a Tessar-type lens. This lens construction is known for its sharpness but can also be built in a very compact manner which was key to our mission. It has the necessary basic sharpness and contrast required to create those expressive images.We made the lens super easy, no technical background is needed. But here is a little information on how to use it:Set your ISO setting to automatic and select “time automatic”. That’s it! You’re ready to go and create your own citography world. You won’t miss anything around you anymore. How is the color applied?By adding colored particles the specific colored look is obtained to last for a lifetime.. The Citograph 35 was developed by a german independent engineering firm according to our specificationsSpecs
Focal length 35 mm 
Magnification ratio 1:8 
Optical construction 4 elements in 3 groups 
Field of view +/- 31° 
Distortion ≤ 1% Light loss max. 27 % 
Focussing 3m bis ∞ 
Filter thread M 37 x 0,75 
Dimensions Ø 58 mm x 23 mm 
Weight ±. 120g 
 The lens will be available with mounts for:
Canon EF
Nikon
Pentax PK
Sony E
Leica M
Micro Four Thirds
Fuji X
  History:C. P. Goerz was founded in 1886 by Carl Paul Goerz. The purpose of the company was to establish a business for mail-order trade of mathematical instruments. Just a year later, cameras were included in the assortment. With the takeover of the workshop of F.A. Hintze, the company began to produce cameras under the name of “Optische Anstalt C.P.Goerz” and, from 1890 on, the production of lenses followed. The outstanding quality of the C.P.Goerz lenses quickly spread and in 1894 C.P.Goerz was awarded the golden medal for excellent camera lenses at the world exhibition in Antwerp. This award is today comparable to an Oscar in technology.The young Emil van Höegh joined the company in 1892 and took over the management of the production, as well as the international sales management. Under his leadership, the world-famous lenses Dagor, Goerz-Hypergon and also the Höeghsche meniscus were introduced.The „Photographische Rundschau“ wrote in 1899:„A rapid upswing occurred in 1893, when the double anastigmat calculated by Mr. von Höegh, the scientific employee of the company, came onto the market. The company became so immense that the workshop had to be moved into a large factory building. „For Carl Georg Schillings, the pioneer of animal photography and nature conservation, C.P.Goerz even developed special designs.C.P.Goerz lenses were built at other locations around the world under license agreements. In New York in 1902, the first branch was established, and in the same year the C.P.Goerz was converted into a stock corporation. The company also opened offices in London, Paris and St.Petersburg. Through 1911, 300,000 lenses were produced and the number of employees rose to 2,500 and later to 12,500. C.P.Goerz was one of the world’s leading optical manufacturers.In Europe, C.P.Goerz merged with other companies in 1926 to form Zeiss Ikon AG. In the US, on the other hand, the Goerz American Optical Company continued to focus on the development and manufacture of film lenses. Because of the high quality of Goerz lenses from 1939 onwards Bolex, at that time the leading manufacturer of 16 mm film cameras, equipped their cameras with lenses made by the C.P. Goerz American Optical Company.In 1972, the C.P.Goerz American Optical Company merged with Schneider-Optics and Goerz thus disappeare  Shipping information:We will ship your rewards worldwide from Germany. For backers inside the European Union: VAT is not included and has to be added on your end. So please add 19% to your total pledge amount including shipping. Please note there may be extra import costs/customs/taxes to pay upon delivery, depending on your location. Customs and taxes are subject to possible change and applicable law at the time of delivery will have to be taken into account. If you have a question about shipping or handling, please don’t hesitate to contact us! If you have forgotten to add VAT/sales tax to your pledge, you can just raise it as long as the Indiegogo project is live. Risks and ChallengesBefore starting this campaign, we have finished the first prototypes and already funded the project via another croudfunding platform. Additionally we have planned production with potential, competent suppliers.Now we are ready to kick-off production. The lens will be made in Asia. Although, we have already planned everything very consciously and are working closely with industry professionals, we might encounter problems in the process of production which we cannot oversee by now. This may cause delays in the delivery.

story:
NOT JUST ANOTHER CAMERA RIG

CAMERA RIG + ELECTRONICS + PRICE + CONVENIENCE: This is not just another shoulder rig.  Traditionally, shoulder rigs such as old-fashion news style camera rigs are weighted pieces of metal mounted on your shoulder.  Those rigs are used only to stabilize the camera.  Our rigs are different.  One of the most unique aspects of our Get A Gripp camera stabilizer is that it has handgripps that have thumbwheels for focus/zoom; index finger triggers to turn video on and off; take stills; and take time lapse photography!  There are other great features our camera stabilizer comes with that no other rig has on the market.  Not only that, we believe that everyone should have the opportunity to shoot great digital films, so we've worked hard to make this rig as cost effective as possible, plus, we've open-sourced everything.  Hack it, change it, reinvent it, show it (to us!). We will put your newly designed ideas up for everyone to use as open-source. We want to see more people making better films for less! Please check out the rest of our page for more details.  Happy Filmmaking!

What Cameras Are Compatible With Get A Gripp?

Our camera stabilizer works with practically all videoing devices - anything that has a threaded-base hole on it (most cameras).  We took a logic tester, caught the open-source codes from all the remotes (i.e. big camera companies such as Nikon, Canon, Pentax, Sony, and more).  It works with all DSLR cameras.  We're also working to mass produce a quick release base plate for your iPhone, Android, and handheld digital camera so you can mount your devices on our Get A Gripp.

Ultimate Stability

NEVER TAKE YOUR HANDS OFF THE GRIPS AGAIN. Our unique Genius Gripps have thumbwheels and triggers which make it so that you can focus/zoom, toggle video on and off, take still photos, and take time lapse photography without ever having to take your hands off the handgripps. Camera stabilizers on the market today have grips with no electronic control functionality, which means you have to take your hand off the grips in order to control the camera.  This causes the entire rig to shake, thus your footage will be unclear and shaky as well. Unless you're filming The Blair Witch Project Part 6, shaky footage is not at all desired.  Get A Gripp allows you to keep your hands as far from the center of mass as possible for ultimate stability.  

Genius Gripps

Our Genius Gripps allow you to interact with your camera in a way no other camera stabilizer on the market can.  Our Genius Gripps not only have all the features listed above, you will also be able to reprogram our smart little Gripp.  You can control anything with an infrared LED interface, or use our forthcoming servo finger to turn push buttons and rocker style switches on/off (like turning your light switches on/off with our Gripps)... So if you decide you want control the sound toggling on your camera for instance, we'll teach you in a few simple steps via an interactive online tutorial (think YouTube) so that you can decide how you want your Genius Gripps to think!

Fits Like a Glove

Our Get A Gripp camera stabilizers are made in such a way that you can tune and adjust both the electronics + modulation and the physical camera parts.  All the physical components including the shoulder pad, battery box, Genius Gripps, and more are adjustable so your rig is comfortable and suited to your needs. Again, you will be able to assign different tasks to your Genius Gripps, so you get the most out of your Get A Gripp.  

Quick Release Philosophy

We use bicycle style camlock quick releases on all the components. The Genius Gripps, the front hexagon (Hex Box as shown below in the photo) and the camera mount. The molded foam rubber shoulder pad has two small durable bungees, which hold it to the tube.  To pop it on tripod, just put the tripod's base plate on our Hex Box and then you can use a one inch piece of tube to mount the rig to your tripod no matter what type of camera you have.  There is nothing faster for setup, storage, and adjustment than our quick release system.

Build Your Own!

You can move, adjust, and even make up new rigs for other gear with our Hex Box and tubes. Our camera stabilizer is dseigned to be so dynamic that you can easily break down the components and build a rugged jib pole, light stand, microphone holder, and more! Get A Gripp camera stabilizers and all its components allow you to create almost anything you need on a video shoot. Wanna make a slider for an odd sized setup? With six or eight of our Hex Boxes and one inch diameter tubes, you can quickly build up anything you can imagine! It's like a Legos set for inexpensive, high-quality filmmaking.

No More Dead Weight (Battery Box)

On most camera stabilizers, the counterweight is just dead weight.  Our 12 volt battery box not only acts as a counterweight (it sits behind your shoulder for optimal smooth footage), but it also acts as a charger for all your electronic devices.  Our battery box has a cigarette-lighter style car charge port and a mini USB charger port. You'll be able to charge devices such as your phone, laptop, or even your camera's battery if you are out and about filming for long periods of time. Plus, the silica gel 12v battery will run the camera stabilizer for over 8 hours! We are dedicated to making economically efficient gear for everyone, which means all the components on our stabilizer have multiple facets.

"We're the Juggernaut, B$%&#!"

RUGGED! Our components such as the Hex Box, our Genius Gripps, and the camera mount are made up of a ABS-like plastic, which is tougher than nails in that they are able to sustain a lot of weathering/impact.  Watch our video below! On top of that, the Aircraft Grade Aluminum (black & anodized) tubing which the rig is made up of can hold up to 200 lb. in bending load!

Oh, By The Way!

We also use 1 inch tubing for everything, so if you need to create something for your specific needs, you can just run to the hardware store to buy the tubing needed in your project and conveniently integrate it into your creation.  It's cheap and easy!   

What if I already have a camera stabilizer?

We have designed our components so that you can attach our Genius Gripps to anyone's camera rigs (yes, all the functions on our Genius Gripps will still work!). So, if you already have a perfectly fine camera rig/stabilizer (they're the same thing, remember!), then you can choose from the reward on the right that suits your needs! 

Here's the Plan (Homemade)!

As you can see in the video, we have a functioning prototype (actually, we have more than just one...)!  In the spirit of keeping things local, we are planning on having our camera stabilizers sourced and put together all in the USA.  The costs of manufacturing our stabilizer in the US is actually quite cost effective, in case you were wondering! All of our materials come from different parts of the US.  We, ourselves make most of the components such as the Hex Box and Genius Gripps using a 3D printer we splurged on!  In this way, we are able to keep costs low, eliminate copy-cats, and making sure our final product is insanely great... Just for you!  We need your help with funding so we can start production!

 

Why is this project on Indie?

Oh, you wonderful wonderful Indie community! Before launching our camera stabilizer idea on kickstarter, my friends and I had always given small pledges, but we had never thought of doing a campaign myself... Until we came up with this idea. We have spent much of our own money developing this project; Bill wants to start a family soon; Jenni is in college; and we have several other (what we think to be) awesome ideas on the backburner which we'd really like to share with you!  So... Please help support us through our crazy endeavor.  By backing our project, you are telling us how awesome you think our idea is!  If you like our idea and want to see us go further with our stabilizer, please select from one of the backer options on the right hand side of the screen. We want to be able to start producing our stabilizers, so you can start making movies. We need your help to complete our project! Give us a kick, so we can start...

P.S. Check out our other ideas which we'd like to share with you at a future date!

• Servo Finger to turn your non-infrared LED activated device (zoom recorder, a push button on a monitor screen or labtop, or even a house light switch).  

• iPhone/Android digital base plates for the steady cam and stabilizer

• full-blown vest-mounted DSLR steadycam at a price lower than anyone elses

Our Story

Once upon a time, there lived three people who loved to shoot videos.  We got really frustrated with really wobbly shaky footage because we had to take our hand off the grip to control focus/zoom or other simple tasks like turning the camera on/off. We really want to keep the camera as steady as possible. Light bulb moment! So we said,"Why can't we program a little open source microproccessor to run a servo, both for focus/zoom, plus, we'll put some triggers on the grips to turn the camera on/off? This way, we don't have to take our hands off the grip, which allows for ultimate stability. Not only that, the servo will pull focus way more smoothly than any human hand ever could achieve. We also wanted to be able to take time lapse photography ..."  We had a few more (what we think to be) awesome ideas.  We wanted to materialize our creativity and produce a camera stabilizer that would help everyone make superb digital films.  We hope you agree with us! Please join us in our crazy endeavor to bring affordable, professional grade camera gear to all of you.  

Credibility

In case you were wondering, we are not just a bunch of goobers! I know, hard to believe, right?  Lionel has multiple degrees, among which include an electrical engineering degree, a journalism degrees, and a business & economics degree!  He's had his own science channel on YouTube, where he introduces a lot of really interesting, revolutionary technology.  Not only that, Lionel is also a airplane mechanic (he built his own plane!).  So, if you're having any doubts aout our stabilizer, please don't worry!  Bill has a degree in photography and history.  Bill is a master when it comes to electronics (think arduino) and is very inventive.  Lionel and Bill are both pilots, so working on large-scale electronic/mechanical projects is a piece of cake for these guys.  Jenni (that's me who is writing!) is more the people-person... I am studying economics and sociology as Mount Holyoke College.  I was also featured in an upcoming documentary called Somewhere Between - so being in front of and behind a camera is quite familiar to me!  We hope this eases your worries about our creation.  

Questions?

If you have questions we did not answer (sorry!), please feel free to contact us at getagripp2012@gmail.com.  We're on Facebook. If you or a buddy are interested in ordering extra pieces or parts, please feel free to contact us! We love to talk!

Check us out on Facebook : Get A Gripp Camera Stabilizers

story:
My story

Months ago, my car was broken into - and right outside of my
house, for that matter - and my camera bag, along with my Minolta-x7a, it's two
lenses, my Olympus e-420, a fisheye lens, and a ton of film, were taken from
me. Two of my most important cameras, my first DSLR and my first film camera,
were snatched right out from under me.

Over the last few months, if I had an event that required me to shoot digitally, I'd have to borrow a camera. It can get fairly old.

My work

I'm now a Senior in the art department at UNCG in Greensboro, NC and in order to create a successful artist's portfolio, I need some equipment - preferably a new DSLR. I try not to focus on one specific photographic style when I produce projects or collaborate with other artists. I've worked with other photographers, musicians for promotional and design purposes, families for personal portraits, and aspiring models. I've uploaded some of my images for you to view while you're on my page and you can always go to my flickr (http://www.flickr.com/photos/90740264@N04/) to view more projects if you're interested!

As much as I love working with film, it can be time consuming and expensive (and I just miss my digital so much!)

I need you!

Through this campaign and your awesome donations, you can help me raise the money to purchase a new DSLR - and you'll get some goodies, too : )


Thanks for your time!


<3 Ash
story_txt:
My story
Months ago, my car was broken into - and right outside of myhouse, for that matter - and my camera bag, along with my Minolta-x7a, it's twolenses, my Olympus e-420, a fisheye lens, and a ton of film, were taken fromme. Two of my most important cameras, my first DSLR and my first film camera,were snatched right out from under me.
Over the last few months, if I had an event that required me to shoot digitally, I'd have to borrow a camera. It can get fairly old.
My work
I'm now a Senior in the art department at UNCG in Greensboro, NC and in order to create a successful artist's portfolio, I need some equipment - preferably a new DSLR. I try not to focus on one specific photographic style when I produce projects or collaborate with other artists. I've worked with other photographers, musicians for promotional and design purposes, families for personal portraits, and aspiring models. I've uploaded some of my images for you to view while you're on my page and you can always go to my flickr (http://www.flickr.com/photos/90740264@N04/) to view more projects if you're interested!
As much as I love working with film, it can be time consuming and expensive (and I just miss my digital so much!)
I need you!
Through this campaign and your awesome donations, you can help me raise the money to purchase a new DSLR - and you'll get some goodies, too : )
Thanks for your time!
<3 Ash

story:
Background

My name is Byron Kirk and I am a documentary photographer from the UK. In 2011 after 8 years service with the Household Cavalry regiment, I decided to leave the forces in order to attend a photography degree at Nottingham Trent University, and am about to enter my third and final year.

As a combat Veteran of the Iraq and Afghanistan war, my most recent work aims to conceptually highlight feelings of loss and social isolation, forced on members of the armed forces community. It presents a non-vicarious, post mortem account of direct conflict and questions the use of violent stereotypes portrayed in popular culture.

(Above: Mum's House. Full photo essay available at http://www.byronkirk.com/mums-house)

Publications

The Mail on Sunday

The Sunday Times Magazine

The Observer

The Daily Star

The Telegraph

Alamy Showcase

Imperial War Museum, War Story Exhibition

The Problem

Due to my up and coming graduation, I need to compile a strong portfolio, which will present myself as an accomplished photographer, with a variety of different strengths. Unfortunately I am no longer able to do this, due to a lack of the right equipment. I am currently working solely with a dated film SLR, as a result, due predominantly to the slow processing time and constant sourcing of quality film, I am unable to compete with other photographers in my field, especially when deadlines are crucial to the publication.

What I Need

The Nikon D800 offers both high quality image, plus sharp 1080p video. It provides the modern day photojournalist with all the tools they require to be successful in an extremely fast paced environment. I will also need an affordable telephoto lens, so that I may avoid too much interference with my subject, allowing for a true representation of their stories, which I hope to document.

What You Get For Your Contribution

Each and every single contribution, will receive a personal thank you email from myself, whilst higher contributions will receive the relevant perk from the right hand side of this page. Contributions of £100 will recieve both a PDF and a signed hard copy of my new photo book, Sandbag, which tells the story of an abandoned stray Iraqi street dog who was shot, then rescued by British soldiers in 2007, then later adopted by a British family in 2011.

If I am unable to reach my entire goal of £2000, the funds shall be placed within a savings account, so that I can purchase the right equipment once I have saved enough money.

(Above: Sandbag. Full book available for preview at http://images.indiegogo.com/medias/959479/files/20130731085732-Sandbag.pdf?1375286265)

The impact

All contributions made by people such as yourself, would provide me with the materials I need to stay competitive, and in turn, allow my work to reach new heights. More importantly, photography has taken me outside of my shell, not only has It allowed me to actively engage with the world around me, but also the wonderful people that inhabit it. By supporting my cause today, whether it be through a large or small donation, or just telling your friends, you are giving me a chance to shape my own future, and for that I am eternally grateful.


(Above: Contact IED... Wait out! Full photo essay available at http://www.byronkirk.com/ied)

Thank you very much for your time, and if you would like to contact me for any reason, please feel free to do so via my contact details below.

www.byronkirk.com

byronwkirk@gmail.com

@byronkirk

story:
Our Story

My name is Kidtee Hello, I am a photographer in Dayton, Ohio and on August 10, 2011 My Camera and Lens was Stolen.  I had it placed underneath the DJ Booth at Blind Bobs thinking that it was well hidden. Well I was wrong and now I have no way to create my art. My Equipment is expensive and since recently loosing my job there is no feasible way I could save up enough money to replace it. So I am asking for your help and in return I will reward you with some gifts! I been a photographer for 8 years and I would like to continue to be able to provide you with imagery.


The Impact

If I do not get a new camera it might be LONG time before I can afford one. Without a Camera and lenses I will not be able to continue my work. 


What We Need & What You Get

I need a camera Probably a 7D or 5D that I can get for 1000-1800 

Lenses 1-2 maybe more from 500-1000

If I don't reach my goal I will hopefully still be able to get some of the gear that I need and if not I will save it and continue to save up for it.


For different donation amounts I will be giving prints, framed prints, and Photography Sessions.




Other Ways You Can Help

Please please please!!! Tell Your Friends!!! and Share the link!

story:
As some of you may know, I recently embarked on a creative personal journey by launching a website and a blog. I love documenting my life through words and photos. I've got the words part pretty much down (or so I like to think) but the photos need some work... mostly because my iPhone 4S camera can only do so much.

For my Birthday/Christmas this year, instead of asking for gifts, cards, books, scarves, perfume, wine, etc, etc, I am asking for monetary donations so I can buy an awesome DSLR camera. (If you really want to go above and beyond, you could also hand-write me a letter!)

The camera I am hoping to purchase is the Canon Rebel T3i. I have a couple hundred dollars but not enough to cover all the costs (shipping, handling, some weird border tax Amazon.com adds on). It would mean the world to me if you could donate a few dollars... I promise I'll take as many photos of you as you like without complaining.

Thanks in advance.

story:
Smartphone Apps

Leave The Details To The Device

Photography is fun! But fiddling with the dials and all the little details is not. Rather than rooting through your camera’s forbidding menu, with the Cubic Trigger app the preset modes are only a flick away. Just set it and forget it, and Cubic Trigger will do all the legwork for you, leaving you to enjoy the scene around you. But don’t worry about your phone being tied down; Cubic Trigger can run in the background, keeping your phone free to make calls or surf the internet while you wait for your masterpiece to come to life. 

 

Keep Your Eye On The Prize

One of the guiding principles when designing our app was to allow the photographer the freedom to focus on the subject instead of operating his or her phone. To this end, we made the function as natural as possible with a simple press, drag, and release action.

 

 

The Basics

Despite all this functionality we didn’t forget the simplest things a camera can do. With basic mode, you can take a single shot, set a self-timer, and control exposure time. 

 

Two Methods Of Dealing With Tricky Lighting -- HDR

Two methods of dealing with tricky lighting: Shooting a subject with huge variations in brightness can sometimes be a headache, but we came up with two painless solutions: pre- and post-exposure manipulation. First, bracket mode will take a series of photographs with different brightness settings and stitch them together to form one optimal HDR photo.

For our second solution, we’ve taken the guesswork out of dodging and burning (as called as black card photography). Using only a black card, you will now be able to do this advanced photographic technique by yourself. The Cubic Trigger app will calculate the best exposure time based on input from the photographer and at the appropriate time will sound an alert to remove the card from the frame. This saves you from having to buy expensive filters for shooting high contrast scenery.  

You can find the technigue guides of black card photogrphy on youtube. 

https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=black+card+photography

 

Time-lapse And Star Trail

Cubic Trigger can easily handle time-lapse photography, even up to very long exposure times. Time-lapse can also be coupled with bracket mode to take HDR photos for HDR time-lapse videos. 

The star trail function is another incredibly useful setting. When set to this mode, Cubic Trigger will take a series of long exposure shots which turn the stars in the sky into long streaking lights. The series is then stitched together to form one cohesive image.

 

Lighting Reflexes

Because sometimes your trigger finger is not quick enough to capture the action, we designed a sound trigger mode into Cubic Trigger that will keep an ear out for any noises that may mean something exciting is going on. It’s also useful as a remote trigger when taking selfies, group photos, or anything else you can think of. Now when you say “cheese!” it will really mean something!

Scheduled Photos

Become the master of time with the schedule photos mode. What would you do if there were a solar eclipse happening right over your town but your boss won’t let you take the day off? Cubic Trigger’s got you covered. You can set a date anytime up to 7 days in advance and your new photo sidekick will make sure you don’t miss the big event.

 

Keeping Tabs On Your Location

With the geo-tagging function you’ll always know just where your photos were taken. This Nikon-only feature will update your coordinates and send them from your phone to your camera once a minute. And with GPS and A-GPS, even when taking photos indoors you won’t need to worry about your GPS receiver losing signal. 

Geotagging function demo on iOS with a Nikon camera indoor.

 

 

Remote Dongle

Independent Shutter Button

Cubic Trigger can act as a stand-alone wired shutter trigger. The button has a 2-stage action to first focus, then take the photo. We have also taken the texture of the button into consideration, making sure it feels as good, or better, than the shutter button on your camera. 

 

Compact Size And Light-weight Design

An accessory is not useful if it takes its own bag just to carry, so we shrunk it down to a dimension of 53.6 x 31.2 x 13.6mm -- even smaller than the average car key or garage remote! Just slip it into your camera bag or pocket and away you go. And comparing Cubic Trigger to traditional electric camera triggers, it weighs in at a mere 14g without its battery. 

 

Detachable Hot Shoe Mount

Cubic Trigger can be affixed to the camera using a standard shoe mount or, for those that like to hang loose, the mount can be removed to allow the device to be operated at any angle. After much trial and error, we found the perfect material that is flexible yet holds snugly on to Cubic Trigger.

 

Long Distance Operation

Bluetooth 4.0 has a range of 25m (85ft) when used in an open environment. Now you can put yourself in your photos without having to set a timer, use a selfie stick, or ask a stranger who, let’s be honest, likely has no idea how to operate your camera. And when taking photos of something else, you now aren’t tied to your camera but instead can move around freely to better control your subject.

Energy Efficient

Bluetooth 4.0 technology’s economic use of power means that under normal use conditions, Cubic Trigger can continue to communicate with the app for more than half a year before the battery runs out. And once that happens, if you have opted for the CR2032 single-use coin battery, all you need to do is buy a new one. 

 

Hardware Specs

Dimensions: 53.6 X 31.2X 13.6 mm (without hot shoe mount) 

Range: 25 m / 85 feet (open area environment)  

Weight: 14 g / 0.5 ounces (Without Battery)

Battery Type: CR2032 battery 

Battery life:  

        Approx. 6 months (4 hours/day, Geotagging off) 

        Approx. 1 month (4 hours/day, Geotagging on)

Interchangeable Cable

Cubic Trigger connects the camera by a interchangeable cable. Simply replace the cable, and it is ready for different camera(s). Currently the cable is available for Canon, Nikon, and Sony. We're planning to make cable for other brands in near future.

Cable Length: 15 cm / 6 inch

Camera support:

  • Nikon 10-pin remote terminal : D1, D1H, D1X, D2, D2H, D2Hs, D2X, D2Xs, D3, D3s, D3x, D4, D4s, D5, D200, D300, D300s, D500, D700, D800, D800e, D810, D850 and later.
  • Nikon DC-2 cable : Df, D90, D600, D610, D750, D3100, D3200, D3300, D5000, D5100, D5200, D5300, D7000 and D7100; CoolPix A, P7700, P7800 and later.
  • Canon E3 type : Digital Rebel, EOS 1000D, EOS 100D, EOS 200D, EOS 1100D, EOS 1200D, EOS 1300D, EOS 300D, EOS 350D, EOS 400D, EOS 450D, EOS 500D, EOS 550D, EOS 600D, EOS 60D, EOS 60Da, EOS 650D, EOS 700D, EOS 70D, EOS 77D, EOS M6, EOS M5, EOS 800D, EOS 80D, EOS 760D, EOS 750D, Kiss Digital, Kiss F Digital, Kiss N, Kiss X2, Kiss X2, Kiss X3, Kiss X4, Kiss X5, Kiss X50, Kiss X6, PowerShot G1 X, G1 X MK2, PowerShot G10, PowerShot G11, PowerShot G12, PowerShot G15, PowerShot G16, PowerShot SX50 HS, SX60, Rebel SL1, Rebel T1i, Rebel T2i, Rebel T3, Rebel T3i, Rebel T4i, Rebel T5i, Rebel XS, Rebel XSi, Rebel XT, Rebel XTi, Pentax 645D, 645Z, ist D, ist DL, ist DL2, ist DS, ist DS2, K-3, K-3 II, K-30, K-5, K-5 II, K-5 IIs, K-50, K-500, K-7, K10 Grand PrixK100D, K100D Super, K10D, K110D, K200D, K20D, MZ-6, MZ-L, and ZX-L, Samsung GX-1L, GX-1S, GX-20, NX-10, NX-100, NX-11, NX-5, Contax 645, N, N Digital, N1, NX, Fujifilm X-E1, X-E2, X-T1, X-T2, Sigma SD1, SD1 Merrill, SD15, Hassleblad H, H3D, H4D-200MS, H4D-31, H4D-40, H4D-50, H4D-50MS, H4D-60, LYTRO Illum, Olympus E-M1 Mark II
  • Canon N3 type : EOS 10D, 20D, 30D, 40D, 50D, 7D, 6D, 1D Mark II, 1Ds Mark II, 1D Mark III, 1Ds Mark III, 1D Mark IV, 5D, 5D Mark II, 5D Mark III & 5D Mark IV and later
  • Sony Multi-terminal : RX100 II, RX100 III, RX100 IV, RX100 V, NEX-3N, A3000, A3500, A5000, A5100, A6000, A6300, A6500, A7, A7 II, A7R, A7R II, A7R III, A7S, A7S II, A9, A58, A68, A77 II, A99 II, HX50, HX50V, HX60, HX60V, HX80, HX90V, HX300, HX350, HX400, HX400V, WX500, RX10, RX10 II, RX10 III, RX1R II and later.

Package includes

   1 x Cubic Trigger Unit

   2 x Camera Connection Cable  (Only one cable for Sony)

   1 x Hot Shoe Mount

   1 x Loop Strap

   1 x CR2032 Battery

Timeline

 

About the Creator

Hi, I’m Simon Yeh, an amateur photographer and software engineer with more than a decade of experience in designing software specifically for smartphones. Being a photographer myself, I always felt daunted and annoyed with all the complicated manual settings on cameras needed to take stunning photos like the pros. And these issues are only compounded when adding a traditional electronic camera trigger to the mix. Not only are they big and clumsy, their small screens and limited button functions can make setup a real pain.

But with the advent of Bluetooth 4.0 technology in smartphones, everything changed. That’s when I got the idea to turn our phones, something we all use everyday, into a simple tool to make photography much more intuitive and rewarding for everyone. To meet this challenge, I used my expertise in software engineering to design the simplest, most user-friendly interface I could. My goal was to come up with an app that is streamlined, reliable, and responsive.

What’s more, living in Taiwan I had access to some of the leading hardware tech companies on the planet to bring my designs to life. In the beginning it was slow going, but now I entering the opening stretch. The first run of mass production is out of the way, as well as FCC and CE certification. The Android and iOS apps are now both up and available for download. But for the final step, we need your help.

Canon E3 type : Digital Rebel, EOS 1000D, EOS 100D, EOS 200D, EOS 1100D, EOS 1200D, EOS 1300D, EOS 300D, EOS 350D, EOS 400D, EOS 450D, EOS 500D, EOS 550D, EOS 600D, EOS 60D, EOS 60Da, EOS 650D, EOS 700D, EOS 70D, EOS 77D, EOS M6, EOS M5, EOS 800D, EOS 80D, EOS 760D, EOS 750D, Kiss Digital, Kiss F Digital, Kiss N, Kiss X2, Kiss X2, Kiss X3, Kiss X4, Kiss X5, Kiss X50, Kiss X6, PowerShot G1 X, G1 X MK2, PowerShot G10, PowerShot G11, PowerShot G12, PowerShot G15, PowerShot G16, PowerShot SX50 HS, SX60, Rebel SL1, Rebel T1i, Rebel T2i, Rebel T3, Rebel T3i, Rebel T4i, Rebel T5i, Rebel XS, Rebel XSi, Rebel XT, Rebel XTi, Pentax 645D, 645Z, ist D, ist DL, ist DL2, ist DS, ist DS2, K-3, K-3 II, K-30, K-5, K-5 II, K-5 IIs, K-50, K-500, K-7, K10 Grand PrixK100D, K100D Super, K10D, K110D, K200D, K20D, MZ-6, MZ-L, and ZX-L, Samsung GX-1L, GX-1S, GX-20, NX-10, NX-100, NX-11, NX-5, Contax 645, N, N Digital, N1, NX, Fujifilm X-E1, X-E2, X-T1, X-T2, Sigma SD1, SD1 Merrill, SD15, Hassleblad H, H3D, H4D-200MS, H4D-31, H4D-40, H4D-50, H4D-50MS, H4D-60, LYTRO Illum, Olympus E-M1 Mark II
Canon N3 type : EOS 10D, 20D, 30D, 40D, 50D, 7D, 6D, 1D Mark II, 1Ds Mark II, 1D Mark III, 1Ds Mark III, 1D Mark IV, 5D, 5D Mark II, 5D Mark III & 5D Mark IV and later
Sony Multi-terminal : RX100 II, RX100 III, RX100 IV, RX100 V, NEX-3N, A3000, A3500, A5000, A5100, A6000, A6300, A6500, A7, A7 II, A7R, A7R II, A7R III, A7S, A7S II, A9, A58, A68, A77 II, A99 II, HX50, HX50V, HX60, HX60V, HX80, HX90V, HX300, HX350, HX400, HX400V, WX500, RX10, RX10 II, RX10 III, RX1R II and later.
Package includes   1 x Cubic Trigger Unit   2 x Camera Connection Cable  (Only one cable for Sony)   1 x Hot Shoe Mount   1 x Loop Strap   1 x CR2032 BatteryTimeline About the CreatorHi, I’m Simon Yeh, an amateur photographer and software engineer with more than a decade of experience in designing software specifically for smartphones. Being a photographer myself, I always felt daunted and annoyed with all the complicated manual settings on cameras needed to take stunning photos like the pros. And these issues are only compounded when adding a traditional electronic camera trigger to the mix. Not only are they big and clumsy, their small screens and limited button functions can make setup a real pain.But with the advent of Bluetooth 4.0 technology in smartphones, everything changed. That’s when I got the idea to turn our phones, something we all use everyday, into a simple tool to make photography much more intuitive and rewarding for everyone. To meet this challenge, I used my expertise in software engineering to design the simplest, most user-friendly interface I could. My goal was to come up with an app that is streamlined, reliable, and responsive.What’s more, living in Taiwan I had access to some of the leading hardware tech companies on the planet to bring my designs to life. In the beginning it was slow going, but now I entering the opening stretch. The first run of mass production is out of the way, as well as FCC and CE certification. The Android and iOS apps are now both up and available for download. But for the final step, we need your help.

story: My close friend Jessica Lehrman recently got all of her photography equipment stolen while home for the holidays in Los Angeles. A true cultural taste-maker, Jessica's photographs have appeared in Rolling Stone, Spin, Gothamist, Vice, and The Source, among others. She spearheaded the documentation of the Occupy Wall Street movement, and continues her cultural observations in New York City by voraciously immersing herself in the underground hip-hop scene. A visionary in the world of photojournalism, her recent work has engulfed not only niche, music-driven demographics of New York, but the city as a whole, garnering her praise and friendships from all walks of life. I have started this campaign to raise at least $10,000 with the hope to simply get Jessica back to where she belongs: with a camera in her hands. Thank you!

story: Hi, my name is Joshua. I am a music event photographer who specializes in night club photography. I was shooting a show, my favorite band actually (Umphrey's Mcgee), and had my camera in a bag. I sat my bag down for a minute and before I knew it someone had stomped on my bag and destroying my camera. Taking pictures is my life and I cannot live without one. Please help me out so I can take pictures once again! Thank you!

Please help me out so I can take pictures once again! Thank you!

story:
My name is Ivan Gonzalez and I am a freelance photographer living in London. I’ve been working with many non-profit organisations in UK, documenting their charities activities.

My photographic work focuses on life-changing human stories in which people overcome their own limitations and set their own challenges.

I need to work quietly in these assignments because many people are susceptible and the sound of my camera’s click always is a disruption. Now, I'm looking to upgrade my photo equipment and the money for selling my current camera is not enough, and I don’t have the financial capacity to cope this investment.

I hope you can help me. I need to buy a professional camera kit of about £ 1,770.

Thank you very much to all who want to contribute.

You can see my photographic work in my personal website:

www.ivangonzalez.co.uk

The money you want to donate I would invest in buying the following items:

- Digital camera Fujifilm XT-1 ... £ 800

- Fujinon Lens XF 23mm F1.4 R … £ 600

- Fujinon Lens XF35mm F1.4 R … £ 370

story:
Are you a photographer?

If so, you might have had the headaches below.

What is MPortable

We are crazy fans of nice photo ourselves. As we had these headache problems every time on every travelling with cameras, all of us are interested in making a special designed portable device for the photographers like us, an amazing device to resolve all these problems. Then, Project MPortable started, on June, 2014. We'll develop a wireless portable SSD(Solid State Disk) to help photographers on the journey.

Features

Easy backup for digital photos


View your photos on pad&phone immediately

Wifi sharing with loved ones


Powerful app helps to organize your photos


High speed portable SSD


Battery Backup


What are the differences with other wireless routers( or hard drives)?


1. The ability to process raw files
MPortable has a powerful processor which can process the raw files. It will generate two JPEGs immediately for quick preview as a raw file is imported. One's size is 126*126,  another one's is 2056*1536. User can use the iPad App to preview his works easily.

Thumbnails(126*126)
 
A wireless routers is a pathway, not a processor. It can pass a raw file from an SD card to your phone, but if you have no app which handles raw files, you won't be able to preview raw files.

2. App designed for photographers
The app of MPortable is specifically designed for photographers . For example, the pick and reject features makes it is easy to sort the photos. 


3. The feature of Plug&Backup
When MPortable is connected with camera, the photos will be piped into the device automatically. No additional steps needed. 

Where are we now?

We've made a prototype of MPortable to test our design. The size of prototype is much larger than our current design. And the color is different. But it is good to test the running of hardware and other tech details.  (July 11,2014). 

We'll update the progress news in time as the project goes.


The Impact

We do not take MP to indiegogo just to raise funds. We value the power of early adaptors in best determine the direction this device is heading.

We'll gather your suggestions and do a poll with the most popular features.

Bringing such an awesome device to life is exciting! Share your ideas with us and help shape its final version. Your contribution has magnitude!

About Us


MPortable was developed by MAJC IT, a startup company based in Zhu Hai,  GuangDong, China. The company was founded by Mark( Ma Qiang), Aimar, Jack and Charles, four co-founders.

Our team has the rich experiences in hardware and software design. We've released a private cloud server named "MAJC Box" (www.majcbox.com). 

Schedule


FAQ

Why do we use SSD instead of hard disk?

1. An SSD has no moving parts, so it is more likely to keep your data safe in the event that you drop your device or your system is shaken while it's operating.

2. SSD is much faster than hard disk.

3. Power saving. SSD uses less power while saving the data.

4. SSD is lighter than hard disk. It is easier to bring it in the bag.

These features are makes an SSD device very desirable for a photographer on his journey.


How much is the MPortable battery capacity?

We're still in testing phase. We plan to take the battery with a capacity of about 3200 mAH based on the our first round testing result. And it maybe become larger in the final release.

How big is MPortable?

We designed MPortable to be so small that it can be easily carried. The current design is about 140mm*80mm*25mm in dimension.

Is this iOS 8 Compatible?

Yes, it is compatible from iOS 6 & on.

Is the device water resistant?

The device will last through rain but isn't waterproof, so don't throw it into the swimming pool.

I have questions, how can I reach your team?

You can always reach us at contact@majcit.com. Please feel free to contact us if you have any questions or suggestions.

story:
** Video above shows a recent story i have covered in Bangladesh. 
*** Since "EMERGING FROM THE ASHES" is a new story, I was not able to display any image/video yet. Sorry! 


ABOUT ME

          I am a Spanish photographer currently based in Hong Kong. I am described as curious, impatient and stubborn. These characteristics have helped me persevere in some of the most difficult story gathering, waiting for that particular moment, where my captured image tells the story. 


To be a photographer helps me to perceive the world not as how it is but the way it is lived in the places I go to, without boundaries to enable me to comprehend my surroundings, to respect other cultures and their way of thinking. Photography helps me to discover new horizons and to value our present as a historical event.


I firmly believe that each person has his/her own unique story, therefore, each of us has a fascinating story to tell.


      Prizes & Nominations:

       2011 - International Photography Awards (IPA): 1st place for Photo Essay.
       2011 - International Photography Awards (IPA): Honorable mentions.
       2011 - Festival EMERGENT-LLEIDA (Spain): Finalist author of the Pati de la Llotja.
       2011 - WPGA - Pollux Awards: 1st and 2nd prize (May - Humanitarian documentary).
       2011 - Manuel Rivera-Ortiz Foundation: Hall of Excellence.
       2011 - Photon Festival scholarship: Winner.
       2011 - Sony World Photography Awards: Commended.
       2010 - Sony World Photography Awards: Finalist.
       2009 - Photographer´s Forum Magazine Contest: Finalist.
       2008 - National Geographic contest (Spain’ territory): Finalist.
       2008 - Boston, USA - BPPA Photography contest: 1st and 3rd place.
       2008 - Photographer´s Forum Magazine Contest: Finalist.


THE PROJECT


        The small republic of Timor Leste has undergone countless upheavals and changes in the last 30 years since Portuguese control over the territory was lost to Indonesia and less than a decade ago, it had to go through one difficult process of independence. In the last decade alone, the birthing pains of a new republic, a society that is finally rid of its colonial masters is still struggling to a point of bloodshed.

 

The country maybe poor, subject to a United Nations observation & monitoring team but it said to be lying in one of the very few last rich oil fields in the world. Scarred and battered through the years of civil chaos, the struggling government is still beset with countless and numerous problems in building a nation, in making an identity as a people and ably managing resources ripe for exploit.

 

East Timor is a test case, perhaps one of the very last few nations in the world during this modern era to build for itself an identity as a nation, blended in the farthest corner of Southeast Asia, in a region dominated by Muslim countries.

 

Documenting the changes and developments of Timor Leste at this stage will serve as the point in time wherever the nation will proceed, from current dismal state or to one of Asia’s roaring tigers. Part of the investigation is to cover the crimes, mistakes and problems besetting the young republic and what future lies for the rest of its people.

 

NGOs, government bodies, local journalists and individuals are among potential contacts that can help me get the goal of picturing a very little known country and the troubles it faces because of the still blurred crimes against humanity that happened there.



WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO?

ALL FUNDS (minus Indiegogo's administrative fee) will go directly toward finishing the project. $2,800 does not pay for everything ( Accommodation, food, etc), but can cover the following costs:


Estimated budget for this project: 

 

COST/ITEMS

AMOUNT (in US$)

TOTAL

(in US$)

Travel: Plane Fare (with return flight)

  • Hong Kong (HKG) – (DPS)

Via Thai Airways

  • (DPS) – Kupang (KOE).

Via Garuda Airline

 

800.00

1,600.0

Fixer (Translator) fee, Local Transport & fuel: 

 

1200.00

1200.00

T O T A L

 

2,800.00



WHAT DO YOU GET

Covering Timor Leste is an opportunity to document in photographs for future generations what is happening to the young Republic. Its centuries old history struggling to establish itself as an independent and sovereign nation brings so much interest for the future.


The nation is rapidly transforming itself and building a society after decades of war, first struggling against the Portuguese and later against . The project will enable countless interest organizations access to images of the present before the nation transforms itself to possibly one of the dynamic nations of and the Pacific basin.

 

The photos can be shared to other projects and groups, that can be utilized for other informational purposes other than posterity and remembrance. There are possibilities that the photo documentary could be published and shared in general circulation traditional media.

 

The materials will also be stored and shared in my personal website, Facebook and Vimeo for others to witness real time the story of the people of Timor Leste including updates on Twitter.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

SHARE it!!  Send this link on! Post it on facebook, twitter, etc.


That would be so incredible if you actually help me spread the word and raise enough.

Any help will be more than appreciate it. 

THANK YOU for reading all this. You are amazing.
